member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebDocumentExporter.TargetPaperOrientation
member.summary: Sets whether the section that the grid is exported to should have landscape or portrait paper orientation.

remarks.p: Use this to customize the page orientation for the pages that the grid will be exported to. This will only affect the grid's section. Other sections in the document can have different page orientations.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebDocumentExporter.TargetPaperSize
member.summary: Sets the size of the page that the grid will be exported to.

remarks.p: Use this to customize the size of the pages for the section that the grid will be exported to. This will only affect the grid's section. Other sections in the document can have different page sizes.
The page size is measured in points.
You can either use a predefined size like A3, A4 or A5 from the enumeration or create a new object with a custom width and height.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebDocumentExporter.TargetPaperSizeResolved
member.summary: Returns the height and width of the page in points.

remarks.p: It automatically takes page orientation into account so you don't need to worry about whether the page is in landscape or portrait mode. It also automatically adds any margins.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebDocumentExporter.Format
member.summary: Determines whether to save the report as a PDF or XPS or plain text document.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebDocumentExporter.MimeType
member.summary: Returns the MimeType that should be used for the that's being exported.

remarks.p: The mimetype that is used currently can not be changed.

The mimetype will be "application/pdf" for PDF documents, "application/vnd.ms-xpsdocument" for XPS documents and "text/plain" for PlainText documents. If Format is not recognised, the propery will return null.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebDocumentExporter.DownloadExtension
member.summary: Returns the default download extension for the that is being exported.

remarks.p: Used by the GetDownloadName() method when it generates the download name from provided by the user and when it creates a default download name.
Returns "pdf" for PDF documents, "xps" for XPS documents and "txt" for PlainText documents. Returns an empty string if the FileFormat isn't recognised.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebDocumentExporter.CustomFont
member.summary: When set, overrides the calculated Font from styles , and uses this one in order to style all text in the report.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebDocumentExporter.Margins
member.summary: Sets the size of the margins of the section that the grid is being exported to.

remarks.p: Use this to customize the margin widths for the pages for the section that the grid will be exported to. This will only affect the grid's section. Other sections in the document can have different margin settings.
The margin sizes are measured in points.
You can either use a predefined size like Narrow, Normal or Wide from the object or create a new PageMargins object with a custom size for each edge.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebDocumentExporter.Exporting
member.summary: Fires before a document is exported. This event can be cancelled to stop the document export.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebDocumentExporter.Exported
member.summary: Fires after a document is exported.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebDocumentExporter.CellExported
member.summary: Fired after the cell has finished exporting.

remarks.p: Use this event to customize the way the cell is exported. Extra elements that appear after the cell's text can be added to the generated cell using the property of the event argument. Style properties of the ReportCell like Alignment, Background and Borders can also be modified.
This event will only be fired for data cells in the grid. Handle the and events for header and footer cells.
This event will not be fired if the event was cancelled.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebDocumentExporter.CellExporting
member.summary: Fires before a cell is exported. This event can be cancelled to stop the cell being exported.

remarks.p: Use this to customize the way the cell is exported.

Set the event argument property to change the value of the exported cell. The value can be set to any type of object and the result of the ToString() method will be displayed in the cell. If ExportValue isn't set, the cell's formatted text will be displayed instead.

Use the property to customize the contents of the cell. You can use this to add new items to the exported cell or to completely override the way that the cell exports. If you want to completely override the cell's rendering, set the property to true to cancel the default export logic.
Styling set on the event argument property won't be applied to the exported cell. Apply any style changes that you want to make directly to the ReportCell.

This event can be cancelled by setting the property of the event argument to true. When the event is cancelled, the logic to export the contents of the cell won't be run but the cell element itself will still be created.
This event will only be fired for data cells in the grid. Handle the and events for header and footer cells.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.DocumentCellExportingEventArgs.Cancel
member.summary: Use to cancel the export of the cell.

remarks.p: If the cell export is cancelled, the text value of the cell will not be added to the grid but the table cell will still be added. This is necessary to make the columns line up.

Use this to override the default export with custom logic by manipulating the object yourself. Extra elements like images or extra text can be added to the export or the report cell itself can be manipulated.

This is only necessary when the structure of the cell needs to be changed. To just change the text that's being exported, use the property. To change the style of the cell set the style properties of the .

member.summary: The value that will be exported to the cell in the report.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.DocumentCellExportingEventArgs.HasExportValueChanged
member.summary: Tracks whether the ExportValue property has been changed during the event.

remarks.p: Returns true if the ExportValue property was changed and false if it's still the same as the value of the cell.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebWordExporter.Document
member.summary: Returns the Document object that the grid will be exported to.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebWordExporter.TargetPaperOrientation
member.summary: Sets whether the document that the grid is exported to should have landscape or portrait paper orientation.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebWordExporter.TargetPaperSize
member.summary: Sets the size of the page that the grid will be exported to.

remarks.p: Use this to customize the size of the document the grid is exported to.
The page size is measured in points.
You can either use a predefined size like A3, A4 or A5 from the enumeration or create a new object with a custom width and height.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebWordExporter.Margins
member.summary: Sets the size of the margins of the section that the grid is being exported to.

remarks.p: Use this to customize the margin widths for the pages for the section that the grid will be exported to. This will only affect the grid's section. Other sections in the document can have different margin settings.
The margin sizes are measured in points.
You can either use a predefined size like Narrow, Normal or Wide from the object or create a new PageMargins object with a custom size for each edge.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebWordExporter.MaxExportLevel
member.summary: Sets the maximum child level that will be exported for a WebHierarchicalDataGrid. -1 will export all levels (as DataExportMode allows)

member.name: E:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebWordExporter.Exporting
member.summary: Fires before a document is exported. This event can be cancelled to stop the document export.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebWordExporter.Exported

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.FieldCaption.FindControl(System.String)
member.summary: This method searches for a locates control objects within the TemplateContainer associated with this UIObject by using the Id parameter to match against control Ids.
member.param: The string Id value for the control to be located.
member.returns: If a control is located within the TemplateContainer of this UIObject that matches the passed in Id, the control reference is returned. Otherwise null is returned.
member.remarks: The TemplateContainer is tagged with the INamingContainer interface. So the Id passed to this method must match the Id of a control within that NamingContainer.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebDataGrid.AutoGenerateColumns
member.summary: Defines whether the grid generates columns automatically during the data binding process.
member.remarks: The grid can automatically generate a column for every field in the data source. If the property is set to True the automatically created columns will be added to the ones set up in the aspx file. If the property is set to False the grid will use only the columns that set up in the aspx file.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebDataGrid.Columns
member.summary: Contains definition of the grid's columns.
member.remarks: The property is available to be used publicly and is serialized into the aspx file. When the property is set to False all of the columns in the grid are taken from this collection, there is no additionally generated columns in this case.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebDataGrid.EnableDataViewState
member.summary: Turns on separation of data and view of the grid. If the property is False the grid is requesting data from its data source on every post back. That applies to the paged grid as well, so if a page is switched the grid will query the data source twice: once for the current page and once for the new page. If the property is True the data is requested once on initial load. Only current page is placed in the view state if paging is enabled, meaning the grid will be requesting new page anyway of data if the page is switched.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.ContainerGrid.AutoGenerateColumns
member.summary: Defines whether the row island generates columns automatically during the data binding process. If the property has not been set the row island resolves it against the band's AutoGenerateColumns property.
member.remarks: The row island can automatically generate a column for every field in the data source. If the property is set to True the automatically created columns will be added to the ones set up in the aspx file. If the property is set to False the grid will use only the columns that set up in the aspx file.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.ContainerGrid.HasDataSource
member.summary: Indicates whether the grid has a data source assigned to it.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.ContainerGrid.IsManualLoadOnDemand
member.summary: Indicates whether the container grid operates in a manual load on demand mode. To enter this mode the container grid instance needs to be explicitly created with a default parameterless constructor and added to the row island collection of a row.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.ContainerGrid.StyleSetName
member.summary: Name of the Application Styling Framework(tm) style set defining the themed appearance for this control.

value.p: The name of the Application Styling Framework(tm) (ASF) style set which has been designed to give this control a consistent appearance with other controls in your application.
This property may return the empty string ("") to imply that the default style set (named "Default") should be used.

remarks.p: Web sites can configure a single, consistent, application-wide style set through the styleSetName attribute in their "web.config" file. Alternately, they can define the style set to apply Application Styling to all controls on a Page by placing a WebPage control on that Page and setting it's StyleSetName property.
At the control level this property allows an application developer to customize the style set applied to a single instance of a control.

Normally, graphics designers will furnish you with a style set containing one or more style sheet files (one for each type of control) and image files. The name of the style set (with the exception of the "Default" style set) must appear in each Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) class name defined by this control's style sheet file. For example, two WebTree controls that each use a different style set, "Aqua" and "Onyx", would expect their CSS class names for the ASF Node role to be "igdt_AquaNode" and "igdt_OnyxNode", respectively. This allows the uniqueness of CSS class names necessary to distinguish multiple style sets for the same type of control, without there being any naming collisions.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.ContainerGrid.StyleSetPath
member.summary: Path containing the Application Styling Framework(tm) style set files for this type of control.

remarks.p: Web sites can configure the directory path containing their style set files application-wide by using the styleSetPath attribute of their "web.config" file. It is also possible to configure the style set path applicable to all controls on a Page that are subject to Application Styling by placing a WebPage control on that Page and setting it's StyleSetPath property.
At the control level this property allows an application developer to customize the location of the style set being applied to a single instance of a control.

Be aware that customizing the style set path at the control level will not allow you to copy a style set's files to this new location, changing a few style property values in them, and then use it successfully with separate instances of the control referencing the original style set of the same name. This is because there would be naming collisions in the Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) class names, which will produce an undefined appearance. You must ensure the CSS class names defined by style sheets in the new style set path are unique from those CSS class names being used by other style sheets that may continue to be referenced. The recommended guidance in this scenario is to create a new style set having a new style set name, that contains your modifications.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.ContainerGrid.OptimizeCollectionsState
member.summary: The collections client state will be stored in the view state and the client collections will not be sent from the client on postback. This will increase page size in terms of view state, but will decrease the postback time numerously, because the collections state will not be uploaded from the client.

From a data structural point of view, trees should always be single rooted, even though trees in a UI often appear to be multi-rooted. member.summary: Name of the Application Styling Framework(tm) style set defining the themed appearance for this control.

value.p: The name of the Application Styling Framework(tm) (ASF) style set which has been designed to give this control a consistent appearance with other controls in your application.
This property may return the empty string ("") to imply that the default style set (named "Default") should be used.

remarks.p: Web sites can configure a single, consistent, application-wide style set through the styleSetName attribute in their "web.config" file. Alternately, they can define the style set to apply Application Styling to all controls on a Page by placing a WebPage control on that Page and setting it's StyleSetName property.
At the control level this property allows an application developer to customize the style set applied to a single instance of a control.

Normally, graphics designers will furnish you with a style set containing one or more style sheet files (one for each type of control) and image files. The name of the style set (with the exception of the "Default" style set) must appear in each Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) class name defined by this control's style sheet file. For example, two WebTree controls that each use a different style set, "Aqua" and "Onyx", would expect their CSS class names for the ASF Node role to be "igdt_AquaNode" and "igdt_OnyxNode", respectively. This allows the uniqueness of CSS class names necessary to distinguish multiple style sets for the same type of control, without there being any naming collisions.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.Data.HierarchicalDataBoundControlMain.StyleSetPath
member.summary: Path containing the Application Styling Framework(tm) style set files for this type of control.

remarks.p: Web sites can configure the directory path containing their style set files application-wide by using the styleSetPath attribute of their "web.config" file. It is also possible to configure the style set path applicable to all controls on a Page that are subject to Application Styling by placing a WebPage control on that Page and setting it's StyleSetPath property.
At the control level this property allows an application developer to customize the location of the style set being applied to a single instance of a control.

Be aware that customizing the style set path at the control level will not allow you to copy a style set's files to this new location, changing a few style property values in them, and then use it successfully with separate instances of the control referencing the original style set of the same name. This is because there would be naming collisions in the Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) class names, which will produce an undefined appearance. You must ensure the CSS class names defined by style sheets in the new style set path are unique from those CSS class names being used by other style sheets that may continue to be referenced. The recommended guidance in this scenario is to create a new style set having a new style set name, that contains your modifications.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.Data.HierarchicalDataBoundControlMain.EnableAjaxViewState
member.summary: Gets sets ability to maintain view state of controls on page if their properties were modified while asynchronous postback of this control.

remarks.p: That property has effect only when asynchronous postback is triggered by this control. Those can be postbacks triggered by AutoPostBackFlags with value "Async", or internal postbacks such as sorting of grid.

If that property is disabled, then properties of any control on page modified while that async postback will be lost after a full postback. Value false will also reduce size of response stream. If that property is enabled, then in some applications the server exception related to EventValidation is possible. If it happens, then application should disable that property or set EnableEventValidation attribute of page to false.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.Data.HierarchicalDataBoundControlMain.InsecureSubmitTokensAsString
member.summary:
Gets sets list of insecure strings separated by the "|" character.
That property is designed to protect application from scripting vulnerability. When request comes from client and the value of the hidden field contains insecure tokens, then all changes on client are discarded.

remarks.p: Note: In order to set the "|" character in token, the flag "&pipe;" should be used.

member.summary: Gets a reference to the DataBindingManager for this control. The Control will normally instantiate a derived DataBindingManager class from within the CreateDataBindingManager virtual override which is called by this Property the first time the DataBindingManaber is referenced.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebHierarchicalDataGrid.Renderer
member.summary: Sets or Gets a rendering object derived from RendererBase that serves to emit html markup that is appropriate to the control. This property can be set by an application to a Renderer other than the one normally provided by the Control. The Custom Renderer can override any of the virtual methods exposed or can implement an entirely new set of rendering logic if desired.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebHierarchicalDataGrid.EnableAjax
member.summary: Determines whether the grid should do Ajax posts when a server side operation is required.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebHierarchicalDataGrid.AutoGenerateColumns
member.summary: Defines whether the grid generates columns automatically during the data binding process.
member.remarks: The grid can automatically generate a column for every field in the data source. If the property is set to True the automatically created columns will be added to the ones set up in the aspx file. If the property is set to False the grid will use only the columns that set up in the aspx file.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebHierarchicalDataGrid.AutoGenerateBands
member.summary: Defines whether the grid generates Bands automatically before the data binding process.
member.remarks: The grid can automatically generate a Band for every data member in the data source. If the property is set to True the automatically created bands will be added to the ones set up in the aspx file. If the property is set to False the grid will use only the bands that set up in the aspx file.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebHierarchicalDataGrid.MaxDataBindDepth
member.summary: Sets or gets an integer value which determines how deep into the DataSource hierarchy DataBinding will proceed. The default value is -1 which signifies that databinding will proceed as deep as the datasource hierarchy. A value of 2 specifies that databinding should proceed two levels below the root level.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebHierarchicalDataGrid.InitialDataBindDepth
member.summary: Sets or gets an integer value which determines how deep into the DataSource hierarchy DataBinding will proceed when the grid is first displayed. The rest of the hierarchy is loaded on demand. -1 directs the grid to be fully bound. The default value is 0 which signifies that the grid is set up for load on demand from the top level.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebHierarchicalDataGrid.InitialExpandDepth
member.summary: Sets or gets an integer value that determines how many levels of rows will be expanded when the grid is first displayed. The default value is 0 which signifies that no rows will be expanded. This value of this property has to be less than or equal to the value of InitialDataBindDepth A value or -1 means that all levels will be expanded, InitialExpandDepth should be set to -1 only when InitialDataBindDepth will also be set to -1.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebHierarchicalDataGrid.AltItemCssClass
member.summary: CSS class name that should be used for alternative (the ones with even index) rows.

remarks.para: The CSS class name is rendered down to the client as an addition to currently specified Appliction Style Set class names.
The CSS class name is rendered on the TR element of the alternate rows and therefore any custom CSS class must have a selector as following: TBODY > TR.[ClassName] > TD

member.summary: CSS class name that should be used for the cells.

remarks.para: The CSS class name is rendered down to the client as an addition to currently specified Appliction Style Set class names.
The CSS class name is rendered on the TBODY element and therefore any custom CSS class must have a selector as following: TBODY.[ClassName] > TR > TD

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebHierarchicalDataGrid.ShowFooter
member.summary: Determines if the column footers will be visible in the Grid.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebHierarchicalDataGrid.ShowHeader
member.summary: Determines if the column headers will be visible on the Grid.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebHierarchicalDataGrid.EnableDataViewState
member.summary: Turns on separation of data and view of the grid. If the property is False the grid is requesting data from its data source on every post back. That applies to the paged grid as well, so if a page is switched the grid will query the data source twice: once for the current page and once for the new page. If the property is True the data is requested once on initial load. Only current page is placed in the view state if paging is enabled, meaning the grid will be requesting new page anyway of data if the page is switched.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebHierarchicalDataGrid.EnableRelativeLayout
member.summary: Adds position:relative to the style of the grid's scrollable element. This setting enables the grid's templates to host controls that use position:relative in their HTML elements.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebHierarchicalDataGrid.AjaxIndicator
member.summary: Gets reference to container of properties related to ajax indicator.

remarks.p: If value of a sub-property is not set, then corresponding property of shared indicator is used. Shared indicator can be accessed on server using Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.AppSettings.SharedAjaxIndicator and on client: $util.get_ajaxIndicator().

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebHierarchicalDataGrid.DataBindings
member.summary: The collection of DataBinding objects that control how each type of xml node is mapped to an item in the control. Each DataBinding object in the DataBindings collection controls one type of xml node based on the DataMember property. The DataMember property identifies the Tag name within the xml datasource to which the DataBinding is applied.

member.summary: The event that fires right before the ContainerGrid is data bound. If this is cancelled, then the ContainerGrid will perform binding directly to the DataSource supplied to the event args. This is to accomplish custom sorting or filtering. This will fire when the ContainerGrid's DataBinding event does, not before as RowIslandDataBinding does.

This parameter is used by WebHierarchicalDataGrid to copy behavior properties. If deep is set to true then the behavior properties are copied as if it was defined on the grid's band. If deep is set to false then the behavior's properties are copied as if it was defined on a parent grid or parent band.

member.summary: Gets a behavior by its interface.

member.returns: First match of the behavior with the interface in the collection.
member.remarks: The method can be used to retrieve a behavior that implements a certain interface. Default behaviors in the grid assembly implement their corresponding interfaces. It is possible to create a substitute behavior that implements an interface that the default behavior use. That way the grid's behaviors can be extended without impacting the core logic of the control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.ColumnFixing.ShowLeftSeparator
member.summary:
Boolean property which controls whether the separator line is shown between the columns that are fixed on the left hand-side of the grid and the rest of the grid columns.
True - show the separator (Default)
False - do not show the separator

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.ColumnFixing.ShowRightSeparator
member.summary:
Boolean property which controls whether the separator line is shown between the columns that are fixed on the right hand-side of the grid and the rest of the grid columns.
True - show the separator (Default)
False - do not show the separator

member.summary: Returns the ColumnFixingSettings collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.ColumnFixing.FixedColumns
member.summary: Returns a FixedColumnInfoCollection collection, which contains the columns which are currently fixed

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.ColumnFixing.FixLocation
member.summary:
The direction to which all columns are fixed to unless otherwise specified in the ColumnSetting object for the column
Left - the columns will be fixed to the left edge of the grid
Right - the columns will be fixed to the right edge of the grid

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.ColumnFixing.ShowFixButtons
member.summary:
Boolean property, which determines if the pin buttons for fixing columns are shown next to the header caption.
True - the buttons are shown, this is the default
False - the buttons are not shown and columns can be fixed only programmatically.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.ColumnFixing.AutoAdjustCells
member.summary:
Controls whether the cell height of the unfixed columns needs to be kept in sync with the cell height of the fixed columns. If this property is not turned on then the cell style may not be applied to the whole cell area of the cells of unfixed columns. However, turning this property on, will significantly slow down the grid and this property should only be turned on for grid which do not have many rows.
True - adjust cell height.
False - do not adjust cell height (Default).

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.ColumnFixing.FixButtonAlignment
member.summary: Indicate whether the fix button/pin is located to the left or to the right of the header caption.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.ColumnFixing.SeparatorCssClass
member.summary: Name of the CSS style class that will be applied to the separator/divider line that separates the fixed columns from the regular columns

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.ColumnMoving.CopyTo(Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.ObjectBase,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Copies properties from the current object into the passed in object
member.param: Object into which to copy properties

This parameter is used by WebHierarchicalDataGrid to copy behavior properties. If deep is set to true then the behavior properties are copied as if it was defined on the grid's band. If deep is set to false then the behavior's properties are copied as if it was defined on a parent grid or parent band.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.Band
member.summary: Server editing events for Band
Extending the Band class so Sorting events handlers can be attached to it
The Band object represents a single level of a hierarchical record set. The columns that make up a band are typically drawn from a single recordsource (table) in the data source.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.Band.AutoGenerateColumns
member.summary: Defines whether the grid generates columns automatically during the data binding process.
member.remarks: The grid can automatically generate a column for every field in the data source. If the property is set to True the automatically created columns will be added to the ones set up in the aspx file. If the property is set to False the grid will use only the columns that set up in the aspx file.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.Band.ExpandButton
member.summary: The button object that will be displayed when a grid's row is collapsed and the row has child row islands. It can be clicked to expand the row to show the child row islands. If the button is left with default parameters on the Band, but is changed on WebHierarchicalDataGrid then the band will inherit these settings.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.Band.CollapseButton
member.summary: The button object that will be displayed when a grid's row is expanded and can be clicked to collapse the row. If the button is left with default parameters on the Band, but is changed on WebHierarchicalDataGrid then the band will inherit these settings.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.Band.GroupingSettings
member.summary: Contains settings for column grouping.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.Band.AltItemCssClass
member.summary: CSS class name that should be used for alternative (the ones with even index) rows. If this property is not set on the band, it will be resolved by traveling up the band hierarchy.

remarks.para: The CSS class name is rendered down to the client as an addition to currently specified Appliction Style Set class names.
The CSS class name is rendered on the TR element of the alternate rows and therefore any custom CSS class must have a selector as following: TBODY > TR.[ClassName] > TD

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.Band.FooterCaptionCssClass
member.summary: CSS class name that should be used for the footers. If this property is not set on the band, it will be resolved by traveling up the band hierarchy.
member.remarks: The CSS class name is rendered down to the client as an addition to currently specified Appliction Style Set class names.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.Band.HeaderCaptionCssClass
member.summary: CSS class name that should be used for the headers. If this property is not set on the band, it will be resolved by traveling up the band hierarchy.
member.remarks: The CSS class name is rendered down to the client as an addition to currently specified Appliction Style Set class names.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.Band.ItemCssClass
member.summary: CSS class name that should be used for the cells. If this property is not set on the band, it will be resolved by traveling up the band hierarchy.

remarks.para: The CSS class name is rendered down to the client as an addition to currently specified Appliction Style Set class names.
The CSS class name is rendered on the TBODY element and therefore any custom CSS class must have a selector as following: TBODY.[ClassName] > TR > TD

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.Band.ExpandableAreaCssClass
member.summary: The name of the css class that will be used to style the TD in which the RowIslands appear. If this property is not set on the band, it will be resolved by traveling up the band hierarchy.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.ColumnResizing.CopyTo(Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.ObjectBase,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Copies properties from the current object into the passed in object
member.param: Object into which to copy properties

This parameter is used by WebHierarchicalDataGrid to copy behavior properties. If deep is set to true then the behavior properties are copied as if it was defined on the grid's band. If deep is set to false then the behavior's properties are copied as if it was defined on a parent grid or parent band.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.RowAdding
member.summary: Row adding behavior. Adding this behavior to the EditingCore behaviors enables user interface - Add New Row - for entering and commiting new row values.
member.remarks: The behavior is supported for both WebDataGrid and WebHierarchicalDataGrid. When the behavior is used in the WebHierarchicalDataGrid it is required that the child bands had some columns defined prior to data binding. Otherwise for some data sources the grid will not be able to determine and generate the columns for empty child row islands.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.RowUpdatingEventArgs.#ctor(Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.GridRecord,System.Collections.Hashtable,System.Collections.Hashtable)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: Reference to the row object that is being updated.
New values. The hashtable consists of the new values to be set on the row cells. The hash key is the key of corresponding column and the value is the new value to be set.
A hashtable of the old values in the row

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.RowUpdatingEventArgs.#ctor(Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.GridRecord,System.Collections.Hashtable,System.Collections.Hashtable,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: Reference to the row object that is being updated.
New values. The hashtable consists of the new values to be set on the row cells. The hash key is the key of corresponding column and the value is the new value to be set.
A hashtable of the old values in the row
New unbound values. The dictionary consists of the new values to be set on the unbound row cells. The key is the key of corresponding column and the value is the new value to be set.
A dictionary of the old unbound values in the row

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.RowUpdatingEventArgs.Row
member.summary: Reference to the row object that is being updated.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.RowUpdatingEventArgs.Values
member.summary: New values. The hashtable consists of the new values to be set on the row cells. The hash key is the key of corresponding column and the value is the new value to be set. If the values are alternated in the hashtable they are applied to the grid and carried over to the data source as well.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.RowUpdatingEventArgs.OldValues
member.summary: Old values. The hashtable contains former values of the row's cells. If the grid contains templated columns or is bound to some of the fields from the data source, the Values and OldValues must be updated to add those missing values. Otherwise missing cells will be nulled out by the auto update operation.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.RowUpdatingEventArgs.UnboundValues
member.summary: New unbound column values. The dictionary consists of the new values to be set on the row's unbound cells. The hash key is the key of corresponding column and the value is the new value to be set. If the values are alternated in the dictionary they are applied to the grid.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.RowUpdatingEventArgs.OldUnboundValues
member.summary: Old unbound column values. The dictionary contains former values of the row's unbound cells.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.RowEditingClientBinding.GetValueJavaScript
member.summary: Java Script pattern to get value from the contol defined in the property.

remarks.para: The string in this property is an encoded string some parts of which will be replaced before they are brought to the client and used. The line of the JavaScript code is expected to return a value which will be used to retrieve and assign the control's value back to the cell. Replaceable parts must be enclosed in curly braces. Supported matches:
{ClientID}
{UniqueID}
Examples:

member.summary: Java Script pattern to set on the contol defined in the property.

{ClientID}
{UniqueID}
{value}
Examples:

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.GridBehaviorContainer
member.summary: The class defines a grid behavior container. Such a container allows creating hierarchies of behaviors and having certain behaviors to be made children of others.
member.remarks: The behavior container is inheriting its capabilities from a simple behavior therefore it has all of the fetaures of a behavior but has an ability to pass all of the events and service method invokations down to its children.

member.summary: Overrides loading of the behavior. Passes the method call down to its children.

member.summary: Overrides unlloading of the behavior. Passes the method call down to its children.

member.param: Object into which to copy properties

This parameter is used by WebHierarchicalDataGrid to copy behavior properties. If deep is set to true then the behavior properties are copied as if it was defined on the grid's band. If deep is set to false then the behavior's properties are copied as if it was defined on a parent grid or parent band.

member.summary: Fires the event. Called by the editing whenever a row is being updated.
member.param: Reference to the row object that is being updated.
Hashtable that contains all new values that about to be set to the cells of the row.
Hashtable that contains all old values of the row cells.
member.returns: True if the event was canceled.
member.remarks: If the grid contains templated columns or is bound to some of the fields from the data source, the values and oldValues must be updated in this event to add those missing values. Otherwise missing cells will be nulled out by the auto update operation.

This parameter is used by WebHierarchicalDataGrid to copy behavior properties. If deep is set to true then the behavior properties are copied as if it was defined on the grid's band. If deep is set to false then the behavior's properties are copied as if it was defined on a parent grid or parent band.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.SummaryRow.FormatString
member.summary: This is the format string that is applied to all summaries' text in the footer. The default is "{0} = {1}" where {0} is the summary name and {1} is the value. Beware that using a formatting specific to a particular type here can cause an exception when other types use this formatting. This can be overriden on a column setting or a summary setting.

member.summary: Determines if the summary dropdown displays the standard summaries as options for the column.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.SummaryRowSetting.FormatString
member.summary: This is the format string that is applied to all summaries' text in the footer for this column. The default is "{0} = {1}" where {0} is the summary name and {1} is the value. Beware that using a formatting specific to a particular type, such as a DateTime, can cause an exception when formatting the Count or possibly a custom summary. This can be overriden on a summary setting.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.SummaryRowSetting.SummarySettings
member.summary: Collection of summary settings for the column. (This collection is meant to determine how a particular summary type will look/function for the column).

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.SummaryRowSetting.EnableFormatting
member.summary: This determines whether to format summary values using the column's FormatValue method before passing that value to the summary format string. If this is false, DataFormatString, FormatFieldMethod method, and editor providers will not format the value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.SummaryRowSetting.PropCount
member.summary: Returns the total number of properties on the object that should go to the client. This should be calculated by taking the amount of Properties on the base class plus the amount of properties on this class. If you are deriving from this object and need to add additional client properties, you must override this property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.VirtualScrolling.ScrollingMode
member.summary: Defines scrolling mode of the grid.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.VirtualScrolling.RowCacheFactor
member.summary: Defines how many rows are kept in the row cache. The actual number of rows in the cache equals to the visible row number times the factor.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.VirtualScrolling.ThresholdFactor
member.summary: Defines the threshold of the rowcache.

remarks.p: That is ratio between number of rows in cache located below or above visible rows in grid and number of visible rows. When the threshold is reached either on the top or on the bottom edge of the visible rows, then an asynchronous request for more rows from server is triggered.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.VirtualScrolling.DataFetchDelay
member.summary: Defines data fetch delay. More rows request is initiated back to the server when the scrollbar is not moving for the specified number of milliseconds.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.VirtualScrolling.TooltipCssClass
member.summary: Name of the CSS class for the the deferred mode's tooltip.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.VirtualScrolling.TooltipVisibility
member.summary: Gets sets visibility of tooltip.

remarks.p: If value is NotSet, then tooltip appears for ScrollingMode.Deferred and does not appear for Virtual mode.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.VirtualScrolling.AverageRowHeight
member.summary: Gets sets average height of a row.

remarks.p: That property can be used to adjust number of rows in cache on initial load of grid, when actual height of a row is different from 20 pixels. It can be usefull, when texts in cells is long and height of rows becomes large due to auto-wrap feature of browser.
Default value is set to 20.
Note: That property does not affect actual height of rows.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.VirtualScrolling.Enabled
member.summary: Determines if the behavior is enabled.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.Filtering.CopyTo(Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.ObjectBase,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Copies properties from the current object into the passed in object
member.param: Object into which to copy properties

This parameter is used by WebHierarchicalDataGrid to copy behavior properties. If deep is set to true then the behavior properties are copied as if it was defined on the grid's band. If deep is set to false then the behavior's properties are copied as if it was defined on a parent grid or parent band.

ExcelStyleFilter - in this mode you get a list of unique values in that column which can be (un)selected by checkboxes.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.Paging.CopyTo(Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.ObjectBase,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Copies properties from the current object into the passed in object
member.param: Object into which to copy properties

This parameter is used by WebHierarchicalDataGrid to copy behavior properties. If deep is set to true then the behavior properties are copied as if it was defined on the grid's band. If deep is set to false then the behavior's properties are copied as if it was defined on a parent grid or parent band.

member.summary: Interface for RowSelector behavior.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.IRowSelectorsBehavior.AddSelectorImage(Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.GridRecord,System.String)
member.summary: Add a css class containing a new image to the row selector's image area.

remarks.p: This method is designed for other behaviors to use. It shouldn't be necessary to use it otherwise.

The images on the row selector are set using CSS classes. The classes will be applied to a div element inside the row selector. It's recommended that you don't set padding or borders in your css or it will distort the width and height of the row selector. Your style will need to set an appropriate width and height to display the image.
If mutiple css classes are applied, the resolution will be up to the browser depending on the order that the classes are declared in.

member.param: The row that the row selector belongs to
The css class to apply

remarks.p: This method is designed for other behaviors to use. It shouldn't be necessary to use it otherwise.

member.param: The row that the row selector belongs to
The css class to apply

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.Selection.PropCount
member.summary: Returns the total number of properties on the object that should go to the client.. This should be calculated by taking the amount of Properties on the base class plus the amount of properties on this class. If you are deriving from this object and need to add additional client properties, you must override this property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.Selection.CellClickAction
member.summary: Returns/sets the action that will occur when a cell is clicked on the WebDataGrid.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.Selection.CellSelectType
member.summary:
Determines how many cells can be selected at any given time.
Note: this property relates only to the UI functionality. Cells can still be selected via the API.
None - Cells will not be selected.
Single - Only one cell can be selected at a time.
Multiple - More than one cell can be selected at the same time.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.Selection.RowSelectType
member.summary:
Determines how many rows can be selected at any given time.
Note: this property relates only to the UI functionality. Rows can still be selected via the API.
None - Rows will not be selected.
Single - Only one row can be selected at a time.
Multiple - More than one row can be selected at the same time.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.Selection.ColumnSelectType
member.summary:
Determines how many columns can be selected at any given time.
Note: this property relates only to the UI functionality. Columns can still be selected via the API.
None - Columns will not be selected.
Single - Only one column can be selected at a time.
Multiple - More than one column can be selected at the same time.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.Selection.SelectedCells
member.summary:
A collection of cells that are currently selected in the WebDataGrid.
To select a cell, use the Add method off of the Collection.
To unselect a cell, use the Remove method off of the Collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.Selection.SelectedRows
member.summary:
A collection of rows that are currently selected in the WebDataGrid.
To select a row, use the Add method off of the Collection.
To unselect a row, use the Remove method off of the Collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.Selection.SelectedColumns
member.summary:
A collection of columns that are currently selected in the WebDataGrid.
To select a column, use the Add method off of the Collection.
To unselect a column, use the Remove method off of the Collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.Selection.EnableCrossPageSelection
member.summary: Setting this property to true allows selected rows/cells from one page to be retained while the page is switched.
member.remarks: SelectedRows and SelectedCells collection would contain the number of items that correspond to the total number of selected object. However those rows/cells that are not on the current page would be returned as null. To get access to the data key and or original index of a selected row/cell from another page Selection.SelecterRows.GetIDPair(index) or Selection.SelecterCells.GetIDPair(index) should be used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.Selection.EnableHiddenSelection
member.summary: Directs the behavior to skip over hidden columns when continuous cell or column selection is being done.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.SelectedCellCollection.GetIDPair(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrives a selected cell's identification object by its index.
member.remarks: In a paging or vertual scrolling scenario not all of the selected cells may be within the visible range. This method can be used to retrive data keys and original indices of all selected cells, including those that are currently out of range.
member.param: Index of the selected cell to get the ID pair for.
member.returns: Item ID pair (row's data key + original index and columns key + index) of the specified selected cell.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.Sorting.CopyTo(Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.ObjectBase,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Copies properties from the current object into the passed in object
member.param: Object into which to copy properties

This parameter is used by WebHierarchicalDataGrid to copy behavior properties. If deep is set to true then the behavior properties are copied as if it was defined on the grid's band. If deep is set to false then the behavior's properties are copied as if it was defined on a parent grid or parent band.

member.remarks: Analyzes currently sorted columns and returns a SQL-like sorting expression. When an expression is assigned to the property the behavior parses it and sorts appropriate columns.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.Sorting.AscendingImageUrl
member.summary: A url to the ascending order image that appears in the header after a column is sorted. If nothing is assigned to the property the image with the name "igg_sortAsc.gif" from current Application Styling images directory is used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.Sorting.DescendingImageUrl
member.summary: A url to the descending order image that appears in the header after a column is sorted. If nothing is assigned to the property the image with the name "igg_sortDesc.gif" from current Application Styling images directory is used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.GridClientEvents.KeyDown
member.remarks:
This event is always fired last in the bubbling queue. If any custom code or grid behavior handles and cancels this same event, this handler may not be invoked. If any custom code or grid behavior handles the same event off a child element, canceling this event does not guarantee to prevent default action.
Actual sequence of events may vary by the browser.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.GridFieldCaption.FindControl(System.String)
member.summary: This method searches for a locates control objects within the TemplateContainer associated with this UIObject by using the Id parameter to match against control Ids.
member.param: The string Id value for the control to be located.
member.returns: If a control is located within the TemplateContainer of this UIObject that matches the passed in Id, the control reference is returned. Otherwise null is returned.
member.remarks: The TemplateContainer is tagged with the INamingContainer interface. So the Id passed to this method must match the Id of a control within that NamingContainer.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.HierarchicalGridBindingManager
member.summary: HierarchicalGridBindingManager is class responsible for managing the data binding process of the WebHierarchicalDataGrid control.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.Data.HierarchicalBindingManager
member.summary: The HierarchicalBindingManager is base class responsible for coordinating and managing the data binding process of Hierarchical data bound controls.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.Data.DataBindingManager
member.summary: The DataBindingManager base class is responsible for coordinating and managing the data binding process. It stores and maintains the collection of WebBinding objects that determine which columns or properties in the data source objects are bound to the various properties of the control object model.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.Data.DataBindingManager.#ctor(System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl)
member.summary: Constructor for the DataBindingManager.
member.param: The control object which owns this DataBindingManager.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.Data.DataBindingManager.DataBind(System.Object)
member.summary: Carries out the DataBind operation on behalf of the control. This method is called by the owning control when a data bind operation is required. The type parameter indicates which type of data is being bound.
member.param: The DataSource object to which the control is binding.
The type of data source represented by the DataSource control.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.Data.DataBindingManager.CreateDataBindingBot(System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl,System.Object,Infragistics.Web.UI.DataSourceType)
member.summary: Virtual method for creating a DataBindingBot object which will be used to carry out the actual data binding operation. The type of DataBot created by this method is based on the DataSourceType. Derived classes may override this method to create DataBots of different kinds depending on other aspects of the dataSource or dataSourceType parameters.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.Data.DataBindingManager.PopulateDataBindings
member.summary: Virtual method called during a databinding operation to notify the DataBindingManager that databindings must be populated in order for databinding to proceed. If the developer/user has added one or more bindings to the DataBindings collection, then these bindings should suffice. If the developer/user has not added any bindings to the control.DataBindings collection, then a default one must be created and added to the DataBindingManager.WebBindings collection.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.Data.DataBindingManager.CreateDataSourceSelectArguments
member.summary: Virtual method used to notify the control that it should create DataSourceSelectArguments at the present time. These arguments are used by AccessDataSourceControls and SqlDataSourceControls to pass sorting criteria and other parameters to the data provider.
member.returns: Returns a DataSourceSelectArgument representing selection criteria.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.Data.DataBindingManager.CreateCollection(Infragistics.Web.UI.IDataObject)
member.summary: Called by DataBots when an object collection needs to be created in order to be filled by the DataBind operation.
member.remarks: This method normally passes on the request to the owner control which will create the actual object on behalf of the DataBindingManager
member.param: An IDataObject representing the parent or owner of the collection that is to be created.
member.returns: Returns an IList collection which can be used to Add objects in turn as they are bound to the data source.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.Data.DataBindingManager.CreateWebObject(System.Collections.IList)
member.summary: Called by DataBots when an object needs to be created in order to accept data from the the DataBind operation. The object created will belong to the control and will store the data from the datasource in order to be used in the rendering phase.
member.remarks: This method normally passes on the request to the owner control which will create the actual object on behalf of the DataBindingManager.
member.param: The collection to which the object will belong.
member.returns: Returns an object that will be bound to and accept data from the data source.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.Data.DataBindingManager.CreateRootObject
member.summary: Called by DataBots to create the single root object of a hierarchical data binding operation.
member.returns: Returns the top-most and unique root object to which further objects will be bound.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.Data.DataBindingManager.RootWebObject
member.summary: Represents the top-most WebObject of the object model. Since hierarchical databinding is based on a single rooted hierarchy, this object represents the top-most node in the hierarchy. Since most controls can contain multiple items at the root level, the RootWebObject represents the parent of the root level items. This structure is similar to that of an xml file where a single root element is required.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.Data.DataBindingManager.DesignMode
member.summary: Indicates the design mode of the control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.Data.DataBindingManager.MaxDataBindDepth
member.summary: Sets or gets the maximum depth for which databinding will apply. This property is only valid for hierarchical data binding. Once the maximum depth is reached, no further children are bound.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.Data.HierarchicalBindingManager.PopulateDataBindings
member.summary: Called to create the needed Binding objects if non have been created already.

member.summary: Returns a default binding when the user has not specified one.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalObjectCollection
member.summary: This class encapsulates the functionality of managing a collection of objects that are part of a series of collections arranged in a tree structure. The class exposes a series of methods that serve to abstract the basic collection operations to allow for collection manipulation independant of the concrete classes that are derived from it.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalObjectCollection.CreateCollectionObject(System.String)
member.summary: This method is used primarily by control developers and derivations of existing controls. Creates a collection object based on an object type identifier. This method is called by the LoadViewState method to create objects of the appropriate type as view state is reloaded.
member.param: The type of the collection object to be created as determined by the string identifier.
member.returns: Returns an object that implements ICollectionObject.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalObjectCollection.CreateItem
member.summary: This method is used primarily by control developers and derivations of existing controls. Factory method called when an object for the collection needs to be created. The default implementation calls the main object factory of HierarchicalDataBoundControlMain where the call is routed to the most derived control class which determines the type of item to create for the collection.
member.returns: A HierarchicalUIObject of the appropriate type.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalObjectCollection.Add
member.summary: This method is used primarily by control developers and derivations of existing controls. A generic method used to add an item derived from HierarchicalUIObject to the collection. This method first calls the CreateItem method which routes the call to the main control where the appropriate object type is created. This object is then added to the collection.
member.returns: A HierarchicalUIObject of the appropriate type.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalObjectCollection.Move(Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method is used primarily by control developers and derivations of existing controls. This method moves the specified item within the collection from it's current position to the position specified by the index parameter. The movement of the item is tracked by the framework so that it can be re positioned each time a page post back occurs.
member.param: A reference to the item to be moved.
The new position index for the item being moved.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalObjectCollection.Insert(System.Int32)
member.summary: This method is used primarily by control developers and derivations of existing controls. A generic method used to insert an item derived from HierarchicalUIObject to the collection. This method first calls the CreateItem method which routes the call to the main control where the appropriate object type is created. This object is then inserted into the collection at the specified index.
member.param: The position index where the newly created item will be inserted.
member.returns: A HierarchicalUIObject of the appropriate type.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalObjectCollection.Remove(Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject)
member.summary: Removes the specified item from the collection
member.param: A reference to the item to be removed.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalObjectCollection.OnInsertComplete(System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: This method is used primarily by control developers and derivations of existing controls. Called by the framework when an object has been inserted, or added, to the collection. This method ensures that the inserted object has the appropriate owner assigned to it.
member.param: The index at which the object was inserted.
A reference to the object that was inserted.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalObjectCollection.RemoveAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the HierarchicalUIObject within the collection that corresponds to the supplied index.
member.param: The integer offset for the object within the collection to be deleted

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalObjectCollection.HierarchicalDataBoundControlMain
member.summary: This method is used primarily by control developers and derivations of existing controls. This property gets a reference to the ControlMain object that ownes this collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalObjectCollection.Owner
member.summary: This method is used primarily by control developers and derivations of existing controls. Each HierarchicalObjectCollection is owned by a HierarchicalUIObject. For example, a Nodes collection in a Tree is owned by a particular Node. The owner Node is then the Parent of each Node within the HierarchicalObjectCollection. The nodes at the root level of the tree are owned by a hidden Owner which is also referred to as the RootItem. In this way, the tree of HierarchicalObjectCollections is referred to as being single rooted.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalObjectCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: This method is used primarily by control developers and derivations of existing controls. Indexer for the HierarchicalObjectCollection
member.param: The integer offset for the requested object within the collection
member.returns: The HierarchicalUIObject that corresponds to the supplied index.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.RootItem
member.summary: This class is used as a container for the Topmost Items collection in an object hierarchy. There is only one of these created for each HierarchicalDataBoundControl. This object automatically gets created by the control at initialization so that the actual hierarchical items can be hung off of it.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject
member.summary:
This class serves as the base class for items that are contained in a hierarchical tree structure and which are also data bound. The properties that relate to Hierarchical items are: HierarchicalDataBoundControlMain Index Level FullAddress ParentItem Owner InnerItems HasChildren
The properties that relate to DataBindings are: DataPath Populated DataItem

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject.IsAncestorOf(Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject)
member.summary: This method returns a boolean value that indicates if the object is an ancestor of the item passed in.
member.param: Reference to the item that might be a descendant of this.
member.returns: true if this is an ancestor of the passed in item. False otherwise.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject._isAncestorOf(Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject,Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject)
member.summary: Helper method for IsAncestorOf method

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject.IsDescendantOf(Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject)
member.summary: This method returns a boolean value that indicates if the object is a descendant of the item passed in.
member.param: Reference to the item that might be an ancestor of this.
member.returns: true if this object is a descendant of the passed in item. False otherwise.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject.InitializeReferences(Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.ObjectCollection,System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl,System.Object)
member.summary: Used by Control Developers only Allows external assemblies to access the internal initializer for objects that have child collections.
member.param: The ObjectCollection to be initialized
The ControlMain object associated with the collection
The owner object of the collection

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject.DataPath
member.summary: Sets or gets a string value representing the datapath into the data source used to popuplate the children of this item (if any).
member.remarks: Only nodes which actually have children get their DataPath property set during a data binding operation.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject.Populated
member.summary: Sets or gets a boolean value that indicates whether or not this item has been populated with children.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject.IsEmptyParent
member.summary: Sets or gets a boolean value that indicates whether or not this item is a parent that has yet to be populated from an Ajax request to expand the node.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject.HierarchicalDataBoundControlMain
member.summary: Returns a reference to the primary control that owns this collection object

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject.Index
member.summary: Returns the index of this collection object within its owning collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject.Level
member.summary: Returns the hierarchical level of this collection object within the tree structure.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject.FullAddress
member.summary: Returns a delimited string representation of this collection object within the tree structure. Each object in the tree is thereby uniquely identified using a unique string representation. For example, "0.0" represents the first child of the first item in the tree. "1.1" represents the second child of the second item in the tree and so forth. "1.2.3" represents the fourth child of the third child of the second item in the tree. The FullAddress property is used to link data to items in the tree on the client and syncronizing such changes across post backs.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject.ParentItem
member.summary: Returns a reference to the Parent of this item.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject.Owner
member.summary: Returns a reference to the collection that owns this object

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject.InnerItems
member.summary: Contains the inner implementation of the Items collection for an item. The derived class can expose or not expose an Items or Nodes collection as it sees fit based on this inner collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject.HasChildren
member.summary: Returns a boolean value that indicates if this object has children within the tree hierarchy.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject.InnerItemsInitialized
member.summary: Returns a boolean value that indicates if the inner items collection has been initialized.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject.PropCount
member.summary: Returns the number of client properties managed by this object.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.RootItem.#ctor(Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.Data.HierarchicalDataBoundControlMain)
member.summary: Creates the RootItem object and sets a reference to the owning control.
member.param: Reference to the owning control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.RootItem.HierarchicalDataBoundControlMain
member.summary: Reference to the owning control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.RootItem.FullAddress
member.summary: Overrides the FullAddress property of HierarchicalUIObject to return an empty string as the root item is only a container of the root items collections.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.RootItem.Level
member.summary: Overrides the level property of HierarchicalUIObject to always return 0.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.CollectionControlObject
member.summary: This class represents a WebControl object that is a member of a collection of objects. The collection of objects would be derived from the ObjectCollection base class so the two classes work together to carry out collection related tasks. For the CollectionControlObject, these tasks include providing and maintaining the Owner ObjectCollection as well as calling the OnAddedToCollection a and OnRemovedFromCollection overrides to notify the object when these events occur. This class derives from ControlObject so that base class maintains ViewState for the object. The ID property of this class overrides the ID property to prevent it from being set because for Templates, the ID must be managed by the framework.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.ControlObject
member.summary: This class forms the base for objects which need to derive from WebControl. It implements templating support, viewstate getters and setters, clientstate support as well as support for uiFlags.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.CollectionControlObject.OnRemovedFromCollection(Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.ObjectCollection)
member.summary: Called when this object is being removed from the supplied collection.
member.param: Collection that this object has been removed from.

remarks.p: The default implementation of this method nulls out the if the supplied primaryCollection matches the primary collection of this object.
Inheritors overriding this method should always call this base implementation to assure the object has only one distinct primary collection.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.CollectionControlObject.OnAddedToCollection(Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.ObjectCollection)
member.summary: Called when this object is being added to the supplied collection.
member.param: Collection that this object has been added to.

remarks.p: The default implementation sets the reference to the supplied primaryCollection argument, if it hasn't already been set (either the base constructor, or a prior call to should have nullified PrimaryCollection from any former collection's claim to ownership of this object.)
Inheritors overriding this method should always call this base implementation to assure the object has only one distinct primary collection.

member.summary: Called when this IKeyedObject has been added to a new collection.
member.param: Collection that this object has been added to.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.CollectionControlObject.Infragistics#Web#UI#ICollectionObject#OnRemovedFromCollection(Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.ObjectCollection)
member.summary: Called when this IKeyedObject has been removed from an old collection.
member.param: Collection that this object has been removed from.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.CollectionControlObject.Owner
member.summary: The primary collection or parent object to which this object belongs.

remarks.p: A CollectionControlObject can belong to only one ObjectCollectionBase at a time, this is their primary collection. Inheritors subclassing KeyedObjectBase may use this property in exposing their own subclass of KeyedObjectCollectionBase offering additional capabilities.
Customarily, the base class implementations of the and methods are responsible for detaching this object from its old collection, and attaching it to its new collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.LayoutPane.EnableRelativeLayout
member.summary: Gets or sets the request to render relative position for content.

remarks.p: Notes: That property is designed to get around differences in behavior of different browsers, when child elements of content have relative or absolute positions. It is recommended to enable that property when child controls or parts of html generated by them use position:relative or position:absolute. For example, WebImageViewer uses position:relative style attribute, and therefore, it may fail to be scrolled in IE or it may go out of content bounds in other browsers.

member.summary: Get reference to UpdatePanel used when async mode is enabled.

remarks.p: Note: that method returns null if ContentUrl property is set. It also may return null if EnableAjax or EnableDynamicUpdatePanel properties are False.

member.param: If value of true is used and template was not instantiated yet or template did not contain UpdatePanel, then template is instantiated and it is wrapped into an UpdatePanel.
member.returns: Reference to UpdatePanel or null.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.AJAXContentPane.UserControlChanged
member.summary: Reinstantiate template

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.AJAXContentPane.EnableDynamicUpdatePanel
member.summary: Gets sets option to dynamically create UpdatePanel when asynchronous mode is enabled.
member.remarks:
If that property is enabled, then Template is wrapped into dynamically created UpdatePanel.
Notes:
If that property has value of NotSet, then corresponding property of owner is used.
It is not recommended to modify that property within a posback, because it may have no effect.
If that property leads to side effects, then it should be disabled and application should wrap template into explicitly created UpdatePanel.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.AJAXContentPane.EnableAjax
member.summary: Gets sets option to enable or disable asynchronous mode.

remarks.p:
Notes:
If that property has value of NotSet, then corresponding property of owner is used.
It is not recommended to modify that property within a posback, because it may have no effect.

Gets sets the alt attribute for IMG element of button when the Pressed property is true.
The default value is [Default]. This means that a Default value will be used unless otherwise specified.
member.remarks: If value is equal to NotSet, then the default value is used, which can be something like "Restore", "Unpin", etc.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.RestoreDialogButton.RestoreImageUrl
member.summary: Gets sets the url for image which is displayed on button when the Pressed property is true.
member.remarks: If value is empty, then the default value is used and corresponding image should be located in the "images" subdirectory at location defined by AppStyling.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.RestoreDialogButton.RestoreImageHoverUrl
member.summary: Gets sets the url for image which is displayed on button when the Pressed property is true and mouse is moved over button.
member.remarks: If value is empty, then the default value is used and corresponding image should be located in the "images" subdirectory at location defined by AppStyling.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.RestoreDialogButton.RestoreImagePressedUrl
member.summary: Gets sets the url for image which is displayed on button when the Pressed property is true and mouse was pressed on button.
member.remarks: If value is empty, then the default value is used and corresponding image should be located in the "images" subdirectory at location defined by AppStyling.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.RestoreDialogButton.Visible
member.summary: Gets sets visibility of button.
member.remarks: If button is invisible, then the Pressed property is still available and defines corresponding state of WebDialogWindow or Pane.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.RestoreDialogButton.IsEmpty
member.summary: Checks if all properties have default values.
