member.summary: Gets sets ability to prevent or to allow losing input focus by dialog's content.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.WebDialogWindow.ModalTabIndices
member.summary: Gets sets ability to dynamically disable tabIndex attributes of html elements located outside of dialog in modal state.
member.remarks:
That property has effect only when Modal is enabled.
Notes for value of true:
If dialog gets visible, then tabIndex of potentially focusable html elements located outside dialog are set to -1. Those elements are INPUT, SELECT, A, DIV, etc.
If dialog gets hidden, then tabIndex of modified html elements are restored or set to 0. That may have negative side effects for some elements like DIV.
If page has too many html elements, then internal logic may take too long and browser will be locked.
Notes for value of false:
Tab indexes of html elements located outside dialog are not modified.
It is possible that in state when dialog never got focus, the first Tab-key press may set focus to an html element located outside dialog.
It is possible situation that continuous pressing Tab-key may stop focus-loop. So, the end user will need to press Shift+Tab or click element by mouse.
To improve focus behavior on Tab-key, it is recommended to set TabIndex of child controls of dialog to high values.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.WebDialogWindow.ModalBackgroundCssClass
member.summary: Gets sets css class which is used for background of page while control is in modal mode.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.WebDialogWindow.UpdateChildControlsByAsyncPostBack
member.summary: Temporary property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.WebDialogWindow.UseBodyAsParent
member.summary: Gets sets ability to use FORM as parent for dialog. If FORM is not found, then BODY is used.

remarks.p:
Notes for enabled property:
That property is not supported if WebDialogWindow is located in UpdatePanel.
Do not use it if side effects occur.
On client WebDialogWindow will be removed from its original container and moved into FORM or BODY. That may help to keep dialog on top of other html elements.
Since dialog will have different parent, it may appear at the bottom of page. To ensure initial location, application may use Left, Top or InitialLocation properties.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.WebDialogWindow.Left
member.summary: Gets set initial location of the left edge of control.
member.remarks: That is an alternative way to set value for the style.left attribute. Note: if the InitialLocation property is Centered, then left location of control will be adjusted for the value of this property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.WebDialogWindow.Top
member.summary: Gets set initial location of the top edge of control.
member.remarks: That is an alternative way to set value for the style.top attribute. Note: if the InitialLocation property is Centered, then top location of control will be adjusted for the value of this property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.WebDialogWindow.InitialLocation
member.summary: Gets sets the initial location of WebDialogWindow relative to window of browser.
member.remarks: That property has no effect if Header.PinBox.Pressed or Header.MaximizeBox.Pressed is true. If value is set to Centered, then the Left and Top properties will be adjusted for the instant scroll of page within browser window.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.SplitterPane
member.summary: Class used by WebSplitter for their splitter panes.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.SplitterPane.SaveClientProperties
member.summary: Pass server properties to client.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.SplitterPane.Visible
member.summary: Not supported property

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.SplitterPane.CssClass
member.summary: Css class applied to the DIV element used to render content of this pane.
member.remarks: Note: The class should not contain any attribute related to border or padding, otherwise it may break apperance of control

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.SplitterPane.Collapsed
member.summary: Gets sets collapsed or expanded state of pane.
member.remarks: Default state of pane expanded and value of that property is false.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.SplitterPane.CollapsedDirection
member.summary: Gets sets the location of a button on a splitter bar which allows to collapse or expand this pane.
member.remarks:
If this is the first pane in the Panes collection of the WebSplitter and that property is set to NextPane, then the PreviousPane value is used.
If this is the last pane in the Panes collection of the WebSplitter and that property is set to PreviousPane, then the NextPane value is used.
If this is the only pane in the Panes collection of the WebSplitter, then that property has no effect.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.SplitterPane.Locked
member.summary: Gets sets ability to enable or disable resizing of this pane by mouse.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.SplitterPane.MaxSize
member.summary: Gets sets maximum width of SplitterPane if WebSplitter.Orientation is Vertical, or maximum height if Orientation is Horizontal.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.SplitterPane.MinSize
member.summary: Gets sets minimum width of SplitterPane if WebSplitter.Orientation is Vertical, or minimum height if Orientation is Horizontal.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.SplitterPane.Size
member.summary: Gets sets initial width of SplitterPane for vertical orientation of initial height for horizontal orientation.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.SplitterPane.PropCount
member.summary: Number of properties in this class written to client state.

member.summary: Renders whole control including attributes and hidden field.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.SplitterRenderer.RenderPane(System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter,Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.SplitterPane,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Render splitter pane. That method should render the DIV inside of the TD element.
member.param: Not null instance of HtmlTextWriter
Not null instance of SplitterPane
Index of pane according to its order in html.
True: horizontal split (rows of table). False: vertical split (columns of table)

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.SplitterRenderer.RenderSplitBar(System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter,Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.SplitterPane,System.Int32,System.Boolean,Infragistics.Web.UI.DefaultableBoolean,Infragistics.Web.UI.DefaultableBoolean)
member.summary: Render splitbar.
member.param: Not null instance of HtmlTextWriter
Not null instance of SplitterPane
Index of pane according to its order in html.
True: horizontal split (rows of table). False: vertical split (columns of table)
True or NotSet: draw collapsable-button for previous pane. True: pane is in collapsed state.
True or NotSet: draw collapsable-button for next pane. True: pane is in collapsed state.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.SplitterRenderer.RenderCollapseButton(System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Render collapse-button located on a splitbar.
member.param: Not null instance of HtmlTextWriter
Index of pane according to its order in html.
True: horizontal split, false: vertical split
True: draw collapsable-button for previous pane, false: draw collapse-button for next pane
True: pane is collapsed

member.name: E:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.WebSplitter.SplitterPaneSizeChanged
member.summary: Adds removes event handler which is fired after value of SplitterPane.Size property was changed by client.
member.remarks:
The value of that property can be changed due to various reasons. Examples:
Property was not set on intialization
Size of SplitterPane was modified by collapse/expand action of other pane
Splitter bar was moved by end user
WebSplitter was resized by its container
etc.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.WebSplitter.SplitterBarPositionChanged
member.summary: Adds removes event handler which is fired after position of splitter bar was changed.
member.remarks: That event is raised only if AutoPostBackFlags.SplitterBarPositionChanged property is set to On or Async.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabAddNewItem.Enabled

remarks.p:

Add-new-tab button is rendered in header as extra tab item located after all normal tab items.
Rendering of special add-new-tab button for MultiRow mode is not supported.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabAddNewItem.AnimationDuration
member.summary: Gets sets duration of animation effect in milliseconds.
member.remarks:
Animation is represented by gradual increase of ContentTabItem size and opacity.
Range of values from 0 to 1500. Values less than 30 are equivalent to 0.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabAddNewItem.EnableTextEditingOnAdd
member.summary: Gets sets ability to automatically start text-editing of newly added ContentTabItem.

remarks.p: Note: client events EditingStart and EditingEnd can be used to control editing.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabAddNewItem.EnableTextEditingOnDoubleClick
member.summary: Gets sets ability to start text-editing of tab item on double click.

remarks.p:
Notes:
That property is independant on EnableTextEditingOnAdd and text of any ContentTabItem can be edited.
Client events EditingStart and EditingEnd can be used to control editing.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabClientEvents.MouseOver
member.summary: Gets sets name of javascript function which is called when mouse is moved over tab, close button or scroll button.
member.remarks: Action (change of image or css class) of that event can be canceled. Second param in handler is instance of TabMouseEventArgs class, which provides information about TabItem or scroll button involved in event.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabClientEvents.MouseOut
member.summary: Gets sets name of javascript function which is called when mouse is moved out of tab, close button or scroll button.
member.remarks: Action (change of image or css class) of that event can be canceled. Second param in handler is instance of TabMouseEventArgs class, which provides information about TabItem or scroll button involved in event.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabClientEvents.MouseDown
member.summary: Gets sets name of javascript function which is called when mouse is pressed over tab, close button or scroll button.
member.remarks: Action (change selection, close tab or scroll) of that event can be canceled. Second param in handler is instance of TabMouseEventArgs class, which provides information about TabItem or scroll button involved in event.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabClientEvents.Scrolling
member.summary: Gets sets name of javascript function which is called before scrolling.
member.remarks: Scroll action of that event can be canceled. Second param in handler is instance of TabScrollingEventArgs class, which provides information about old and new scroll values.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabClientEvents.Scrolled
member.summary: Gets sets name of javascript function which is called after tabs were scrolled.
member.remarks: Scroll action of that event cannot be canceled. Second param in handler is instance of TabScrolledEventArgs class, which provides information about old and new scroll values.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabClientEvents.SelectedIndexChanging
member.summary: Gets sets name of javascript function which is called before tab was selected.
member.remarks: Selection change can be canceled. Second param in handler is instance of TabSelectedIndexChangingEventArgs class, which provides information about old and new selected TabItems.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabClientEvents.SelectedIndexChanged
member.summary: Gets sets name of javascript function which is called after tab was selected.
member.remarks: Action cannot be canceled and postback can be triggered. Second param in handler is instance of TabItemPostBackEventArgs class, which provides information about selected TabItem.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabClientEvents.Loaded
member.summary: Gets sets name of javascript function which is called after all subobjects of control were initialized (first paint).

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabClientEvents.TabClosing
member.summary: Gets sets name of javascript function which is called before closing tab.
member.remarks: Action can be canceled. Second param in handler is instance of TabItemCancelEventArgs class, which provides information about TabItem.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabClientEvents.TabClosed
member.summary: Gets sets name of javascript function which is called after tab was closed.
member.remarks: Action cannot be canceled and postback can be triggered. Second param in handler is instance of TabItemPostBackEventArgs class, which provides information about TabItem which was closed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabClientEvents.AjaxSubmitting
member.summary: Gets sets name of javascript function which is called before submitting an UpdatePanel of tab.
member.remarks:
That event is raised only when submit of UpdatePanel was triggered by tab change or mouse click on already selected tab.
That is event is not raised when UpdatePanel was submitted by a local element like button.
Action can be canceled. Second param in handler is instance of TabItemCancelEventArgs class, which provides information about TabItem.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabClientEvents.AjaxSubmitted
member.summary: Gets sets name of javascript function which is called after UpdatePanel of tab was submitted.
member.remarks:
That event is raised only when submit of UpdatePanel was triggered by tab change or by mouse click on already selected tab and it is invoked by PageRequestManager.beginRequest.
That is event is not raised when UpdatePanel was submitted by a local element like button.
Action cannot be canceled. Second param in handler is instance of TabItemEventArgs class, which provides information about TabItem.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabClientEvents.AjaxLoaded
member.summary: Gets sets name of javascript function which is called when content of UpdatePanel of tab was refreshed from server.
member.remarks:
That event is raised only when submit of UpdatePanel was triggered by tab change or by mouse click on already selected tab and it is invoked by PageRequestManager.endRequest.
That is event is not raised when UpdatePanel is loaded on initialization or after a full postback.
Action cannot be canceled. Second param in handler is instance of TabItemEventArgs class, which provides information about TabItem.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabClientEvents.UrlSubmitting
member.summary: Gets sets name of javascript function which is called before ContentUrl of tab was submitted.
member.remarks:
That event is raised only when submit of ContentUrl was triggered by tab change or by mouse click on already selected tab.
Action can be canceled. Second param in handler is instance of TabItemCancelEventArgs class, which provides information about TabItem.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabClientEvents.UrlSubmitted
member.summary: Gets sets name of javascript function which is called after ContentUrl of tab was submitted.
member.remarks:
That event is raised only when submit of ContentUrl was triggered by tab change or by mouse click on already selected tab.
Action cannot be canceled. Second param in handler is instance of TabItemEventArgs class, which provides information about TabItem.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabClientEvents.UrlLoadRequest
member.summary: Gets sets name of javascript function which is called when ContentUrl of tab was requested to load.
member.remarks:
That event is raised only when user selected a TabItem which ContentUrl was not loaded before.
That is event is not raised when ContentUrl is loaded on initialization or after a postback.
Action cannot be canceled. Second param in handler is instance of TabItemEventArgs class, which provides information about TabItem.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabClientEvents.UrlLoaded
member.summary: Gets sets name of javascript function which is called when ContentUrl of tab was loaded or refreshed from server.
member.remarks:
That event is raised only when ContentUrl contains local aspx, but not a web site.
Action cannot be canceled. Second param in handler is instance of TabItemEventArgs class, which provides information about TabItem.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabClientEvents.IndicatorShow
member.summary: Gets sets name of javascript function which is called before showing ajax indicator.
member.remarks: Action can be canceled. Second param in handler is instance of TabItemCancelEventArgs class, which provides information about TabItem.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabClientEvents.IndicatorHide
member.summary: Gets sets name of javascript function which is called when ajax indicator was hidden.
member.remarks: Action cannot be canceled. Second param in handler is instance of TabItemCancelEventArgs class, which provides information about TabItem.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabClientEvents.Focus
member.summary: Gets sets name of javascript function which is called when control gets focus.
member.remarks:
Action cannot be canceled.
Note: that event is raised when tab header/label gets focus and ready to process key events. It is not raised when content pane gets focus.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabClientEvents.Blur
member.summary: Gets sets name of javascript function which is called when control loses focus.
member.remarks:
Action cannot be canceled.
Note: that event is raised when tab header/label loses focus. It is not raised when content pane loses focus.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabClientEvents.KeyDown
member.summary: Gets sets name of javascript function which is called when control gets keydown event.
member.remarks: Action can be canceled.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabClientEvents.ActiveTabChange
member.summary: Gets sets name of javascript function which is called before active TabItem was changed.
member.remarks:
Note: That event is raised only when EnableActivation property of WebTab is set to true.
Action can be canceled. Second param in handler is instance of TabItemCancelEventArgs class, which provides information about TabItem which is activated.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabClientEvents.TabMovingStart
member.summary: Gets sets name of javascript function which is called before start of tab moving.
member.remarks: Action can be canceled. Second param in handler is instance of TabItemCancelEventArgs class, which provides information about TabItem which is going to be moved.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabClientEvents.TabMoving
member.summary: Gets sets name of javascript function which is called before tab was temporary moved to new location.
member.remarks: Action can be canceled. Second param in handler is instance of TabMovingEventArgs class, which provides information about TabItem which is going to be moved.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabClientEvents.TabMoved
member.summary: Gets sets name of javascript function which is called after tab was temporary moved to new location.
member.remarks: Action cannot be canceled. Second param in handler is instance of TabMovedEventArgs class, which provides information about TabItem which was moved.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabClientEvents.TabMovingEnd
member.summary: Gets sets name of javascript function which is called before tab was permanently moved to new location.
member.remarks: Action can be canceled and in this case TabItem is moved back to its original position before TabMovingStart. Second param in handler is instance of TabMovingEventArgs class, which provides information about TabItem which is going to be moved.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabClientEvents.TabMovedEnd
member.summary: Gets sets name of javascript function which is called after tab was permanently moved to new location.
member.remarks: Action cannot be canceled and postback can be triggered. Second param in handler is instance of TabItemPostBackEventArgs class, which provides information about TabItem which was moved.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabClientEvents.TabAdding
member.summary: Gets sets name of javascript function which is called before new tab was added.
member.remarks: Action can be canceled. Second param in handler is instance of TabItemCancelEventArgs class, which provides index of new TabItem. At this point TabItem is not created yet.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabClientEvents.TabAdded
member.summary: Gets sets name of javascript function which is called after new tab was added.
member.remarks: Action cannot be canceled and postback can be triggered. Second param in handler is instance of TabItemPostBackEventArgs class, which provides information about TabItem which was added.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabClientEvents.TabAddAnimationEnded
member.summary: Gets sets name of javascript function which is called after animation of add-new tab was ended.
member.remarks: Action cannot be canceled. Second param in handler is instance of TabItemEventArgs class, which provides information about TabItem which animation was ended.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabClientEvents.StartEditing
member.summary: Gets sets name of javascript function which is called before start text-editing of TabItem.
member.remarks: Action can be canceled. Second param in handler is instance of TabItemCancelEventArgs class, which provides information about TabItem which text will be edited.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabClientEvents.EndEditing
member.summary: Gets sets name of javascript function which is called before end text-editing of TabItem.
member.remarks: End edit mode cannot be canceled, but update of text can be canceled and new text can be modified. Second param in handler is instance of TabItemEndEditingEventArgs class, which provides information about TabItem which text was edited and value of new text.

member.summary: Reset all properties.

member.summary: Shows or hides close buttons on tabs.
member.remarks: When user clicks that button, then the ContentTabItem is not removed, but its Hidden property is set to true.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabCloseButton.CssClass
member.summary: Gets sets the custom css class applied to the close button.

remarks.p: That class is merged with igtab_XXClose.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabCloseButton.SizeCssClass
member.summary: Gets sets the custom css class applied to the tab item in order to adjust its size to fit close button.
member.remarks: It should contain padding which match with location and size of close button. That class is merged with igtab_XXCloseSize.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabCloseButton.ImageUrl
member.summary: Gets sets the custom css class applied to the close button in normal state.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabCloseButton.HoverImageUrl
member.summary: Gets sets the custom css class applied to the close button when mouse is moved over it.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabCloseButton.AnimationDuration
member.summary: Gets sets duration of close animation effect in milliseconds.
member.remarks:
Animation is represented by gradual decrease of tab item size and opacity.
Range of values from 0 to 1500. Values less than 30 are equivalent to 0.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabCloseButton.ImageAltText
member.summary: Gets sets the custom alt attribute for image.

remarks.p: If value is equal to "[Default]", then the default value is used.

member.summary: Gets sets tooltip.

member.param: Owner of this class.

member.summary: Returns string formatted for visual designer.
member.returns: Empty string or string similar to "(Has Data)".

member.summary: Check if RoundedBackground has data.

member.summary: Reset all properties.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabContentPane.CssClass
member.summary: Gets sets the custom css class applied to the content panes of tabs.

remarks.p: That class is merged with igtab_XXContent.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabContentPane.HolderCssClass
member.summary: Gets sets the custom css class applied to the holder of content panes of tabs.

remarks.p: That class is merged with igtab_XXContentHolder.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabContentPane.HolderInnerCssClass
member.summary: Gets sets the custom css class applied to the inner holder of content panes of tabs.

remarks.p: That class is merged with igtab_XXContentHolderInner and it is used only when tabs are located on right.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabContentPane.MaxWidth
member.summary: Gets sets maximum width of content pane.
member.remarks:
The value of 0 disables that property. If TabLocation is top/bottom, then that property is used to set the style:"max-width" of main DIV of WebTab.
Note: that property can be used when AutoSize is enabled, though, not all browsers support that.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabContentPane.MinWidth
member.summary: Gets sets minimum width of content pane.
member.remarks:
The value of 0 disables that property. If TabLocation is top/bottom, then that property is used to set the style:"min-width" of main DIV of WebTab.
Note: that property can be used when AutoSize is enabled, though, not all browsers support that.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabContentPane.MaxHeight
member.summary: Gets sets maximum height of content pane.
member.remarks:
The value of 0 disables that property. That property has effect only when AutoSize is enabed or when height of WebTab is not set or it is set to percent value. If TabLocation is top/bottom, then that property is used to dynamically limit maximum height of content pane.
Note: not all browsers support that feature.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabContentPane.MinHeight
member.summary: Gets sets minimum height of content pane.
member.remarks:
The value of 0 disables that property. That property has effect only when AutoSize is enabed or when height of WebTab is not set or it is set to percent value. If TabLocation is top/bottom, then that property is used to dynamically limit minimum height of content pane.
Note: not all browsers support that feature.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabContentPane.AutoSize
member.summary: Gets sets option to adjust size of WebTab to fit content of selected tab item.

remarks.p: If that property is enabled and height or width of content does not fit in bounds of WebTab, then height or width of WebTab is automatically increased. If height or width of content is smaller than current bounds of WebTab, then width and height of WebTab are not affected.
If Width or Height of WebTab is not set, then autosize is enabled automatically for Width or Height.
The MaxWidth and MaxHeight have priority over that property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabContentPane.RoundedBackground
member.summary: Gets reference to container of properties related to rounded background under content panes.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabContentPane.IsEmpty
member.summary: Checks if all properties have default values.

member.summary: Number of properties in this class written to client state.

member.summary: Not supported property

member.summary: Get sets enabled state of ContentTabItem

member.summary: Get sets an option to enable or disable default borders of IFRAME used for ContentUrl.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.ContentTabItem.ToolTip
member.summary: Tooltip for label of tab item

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.ContentTabItem.CssClass
member.summary: Css class applied to the DIV element used to render content of this pane.
member.remarks: Note: The class should not contain any attribute related to border or padding, otherwise it may break apperance of control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.ContentTabItem.Text
member.summary: Gets sets text displayed on ContentTabItem.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.ContentTabItem.Hidden
member.summary: Gets sets hidden state of tab.
member.remarks: That property does not affect content pane, but only visibility of tab-label.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.ContentTabItem.EnableCloseButton
member.summary: Gets sets the visibility of close button.
member.remarks: If that property is set to NotSet, then CloseButton.Enabled property of WebTab is used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.ContentTabItem.AutoSize
member.summary: Gets sets the ability to resize WebTab to fit content of this pane.
member.remarks: If that property is set to NotSet, then ContentPane.AutoSize property of WebTab is used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.ContentTabItem.VisibleIndex
member.summary: Gets sets visible index of this ContentTabItem within Tabs of WebTab.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.ContentTabItem.TabSize
member.summary: Gets sets width of ContentTabItem when TabOrientation is horizontal or height of ContentTabItem when TabOrientation is vertical.

remarks.p:
Notes:
Please see notes for WebTab.TabItemSize.
If tabs are located at top or bottom and orientation is vertical, then that property has no effect and WebTab.TabItemSize should be used.
If tabs are located at left or right and orientation is horizontal, then that property has no effect and WebTab.TabItemSize should be used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.ContentTabItem.Key
member.summary: Gets sets key associated with tab item.

remarks.p:
Note:
That property can be used to find item within collection by FromKey method.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.ContentTabItem.MarginLeading
member.summary: Get sets margin in front of this tab item.

remarks.p: That defines space/separator between tab items.

Notes:
Only pixel values are supported
If DisplayMode of WebTab is set to multi-row, then that property is not supported
If tabs are located on left or right, then actual margin is defined by largest value among this property and MarginTrailing of previous tab item.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.ContentTabItem.MarginTrailing
member.summary: Get sets margin between this tab item and next.

remarks.p: That defines space/separator between tab items.

Notes:
Only pixel values are supported
If DisplayMode of WebTab is set to multi-row, then that property is not supported
If tabs are located on left or right, then actual margin is defined by largest value among this property and MarginLeading of next tab item.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.ContentTabItem.NextRow
member.summary: Gets sets new row for tab item when DisplayMode of WebTab is set to MultiRow.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.ContentTabItem.ImageAlignment
member.summary: Gets sets the location of image relative to the text.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.ContentTabItem.ImageAltText
member.summary: Gets sets alt attribute for image displayed on tab item.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.ContentTabItem.ImageUrl
member.summary: Gets sets url for image displayed on tab item in normal state.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.ContentTabItem.HoverImageUrl
member.summary: Gets sets url for image displayed on tab item when mouse is moved over it.

remarks.p: That property has effect only when ImageUrl is set. That property has priority over images defined by SelectedImageUrl and ActiveImageUrl.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.ContentTabItem.SelectedImageUrl
member.summary: Gets sets url for image displayed on selected tab item.

remarks.p: That property has effect only when ImageUrl is set. The images defined by HoverImageUrl and ActiveImageUrl have priority over that property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.ContentTabItem.DisabledImageUrl
member.summary: Gets sets url for image displayed on disabled tab item.

remarks.p: That property has effect only when ImageUrl is set. That image has priority over all other image related properties.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.ContentTabItem.ActiveImageUrl
member.summary: Gets sets url for image displayed on active tab item.

remarks.p: That property has effect only when ImageUrl is set. That image has priority over SelectedImageUrl. The image defined by HoverImageUrl has priority over that property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.ContentTabItem.EnableLoadOnDemandUrl
member.summary: Gets sets option to load url content of selected tab only.

remarks.p:
Notes: If that property is set to NotSet, then PostBackOptions.EnableLoadOnDemandUrl property of WebTab is used.
That property has affect only when ContentUrl is set.

member.summary: Gets reference to container of properties related to custom css classes used by this tab item.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabPostBackOptions

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabPostBackOptions.#ctor(Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.WebTab)
member.summary: Constructor for TabPostBackOptions
member.param: Owner of this class.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabPostBackOptions.ToString
member.summary: Returns string formatted for visual designer.
member.returns: Empty string or string similar to "(Has Data)".

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabPostBackOptions.Reset
member.summary: Reset all properties.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabPostBackOptions.EnableAjax
member.summary: Gets sets option to enable asynchronous postback of WebTab.

remarks.p:
Notes:
Asynchronous functionality is achived by wrapping content of tabs into UpdatePanels.
It is not recommended to modify that property within a posback, because it will trigger recreation of templates in all tab items, which may slow down performance.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabPostBackOptions.EnableDynamicUpdatePanels
member.summary: Gets sets option to create UpdatePanels dynamically when asynchronous postback is enabled.

remarks.p:
Notes:
If EnableAjax is enabled and EnabledLoadOnDemand is disabled, then dynamic UpdatePanels are created regardless of that property.
It is not recommended to modify that property within a posback, because it will trigger recreation of templates in all tab items, which may slow down performance.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabPostBackOptions.EnableAsyncUpdateAllTabs
member.summary: Gets sets option to update content of all tabs if asynchronous postback was triggered by any tab.

remarks.p: Note: that property has effect for tab items which have templates and EnableAjax is enabled and EnabledLoadOnDemand is disabled.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabPostBackOptions.EnableReloadingUnselectedTab
member.summary: Gets sets option to submit/update content of unselected tab when selection was changed.

remarks.p:
Notes:
That property has effect for tab items which have ContentUrl or which have templates and EnableAjax is enabled and EnabledLoadOnDemand is disabled.
It is not recommended to modify that property within a posback, because it will trigger recreation of templates in all tab items, which may slow down performance.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabPostBackOptions.EnableReloadingOnTabClick
member.summary: Gets sets option to submit/update/reload content of already selected tab when it was clicked by mouse.

remarks.p:
Possible cases:
If tab item points to a local ContentUrl, then that local aspx is submitted.
If ContentUrl points to an external website, then that site is reloaded.
If Ajax is enabled, then asynchronous postback is used, otherwise, a full postback is triggered.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabPostBackOptions.EnableLoadOnDemand
member.summary: Gets sets option to load template of selected tab only.

remarks.p:
Notes:
If that property triggers side effects, then it should not be used.
If that property is enabled, then EnableAsyncUpdateAllTabs and EnableReloadingUnselectedTab properties have no effect and dynamic UpdatePanels are created.
It is not recommended to modify that property within a posback, because it will trigger recreation of templates in all tab items, which may slow down performance.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabPostBackOptions.EnableLoadOnDemandUrl
member.summary: Gets sets option to load url content of selected tab only.

remarks.p:
Notes:
That property affects only tabs which have value set to their ContentUrl property. That property can be used when web-sites run scripts like jQuiry.js which may attempt to set focus or calculate offsets on initialization regardless of html element visibility. Those can be illegal actions and javascript exceptions can be raised. So, that property allows to load only visible selected ContentUrl and get around bugs in those web sites.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabPostBackOptions.EnableLoadOnDemandViewState
member.summary: Gets sets option to reload all once loaded templates on full postback.

remarks.p:
Note:
That property has effect only when EnableLoadOnDemand is true.
If it is enabled, then all once loaded templates are reloaded on all full postbacks.
While asynchronous postbacks all once loaded templates in UpdatePanels are reloaded regardless of that property, otherwise, server raises exception due to failed EventValidation.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabPostBackOptions.IsEmpty
member.summary: Checks if all properties have default values.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabRoundedBackground.CornersCssClass
member.summary: Gets sets the custom css class applied to the corners.

remarks.p:
Notes: that class should contain background-image attribute and it is merged with igtab_XXRoundedCorners.
Image should contain all 4 corners and should be at least twice large than SizeOfCorners.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabRoundedBackground.LeftRightCssClass
member.summary: Gets sets the custom css class applied to the left and right edges.

remarks.p:
Notes: that class should contain background-image attribute and it is merged with igtab_XXRoundedLeftRight.
Image should contain left and right edges and its width should be at least twice large than SizeOfCorners.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabRoundedBackground.TopBottomCssClass
member.summary: Gets sets the custom css class applied to the top and bottom edges.

remarks.p:
Notes: that class should contain background-image attribute and it is merged with igtab_XXRoundedTopBottom.
Image should contain top and bottom edges and its height should be at least twice large than SizeOfCorners.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabRoundedBackground.FillCssClass
member.summary: Gets sets the custom css class applied to the center area.

remarks.p:
Notes: that class should contain background-image attribute and it is merged with igtab_XXRoundedFill.
Image should contain fill for center area. It can be of any size.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabRoundedBackground.HolderOfTabsCssClass
member.summary: Gets sets the custom css class applied to the holder of tabs when rounded background is enabled.

remarks.p:
Notes: that class is merged with igtab_XXRoundedForHolder.
It allows to remove possible border between tabs and content pane and create padding for tabs.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabRoundedBackground.HolderOfScrollButtonsCssClass
member.summary: Gets sets the custom css class applied to the holder of scroll buttons when rounded background is enabled.

remarks.p:
Notes: that class is merged with igtab_XXRoundedForScroll.
It allows to compensate possible padding defined by HolderOfTabsCssClass.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabRoundedBackground.HolderOfScrollableTabsCssClass
member.summary: Gets sets the custom css class applied to the holder of tabs when rounded background is enabled and tabs are scrollable.

remarks.p:
Notes: that class is merged with igtab_XXRoundedForHolderScroll and it is used only when orientation of tabs is left or right.
It allows to shift tabs vertically and it should contain only the top style attribute.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabRoundedBackground.HolderInnerOfTabsCssClass
member.summary: Gets sets the custom css class applied to the inner holder of tabs when rounded background is enabled.

remarks.p:
Notes: that class is merged with igtab_XXRoundedForHolderInner and it is used only when orientation of tabs is left or right.
It allows to shift tabs vertically and it should contain only the top style attribute.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.TabRoundedBackground.HolderInnerOfScrollableTabsCssClass
member.summary: Gets sets the custom css class applied to the inner holder of tabs when rounded background is enabled and tabs are scrollable.

remarks.p:
Notes: that class is merged with igtab_XXRoundedForHolderScrollInner and it is used only when orientation of tabs is left or right.
It allows to shift tabs vertically and it should contain only the top style attribute.

member.summary: Find item with matching Key property.
member.param: Value of the Key property.
member.returns: Reference to the first found ContentTabItem or null.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.WebTab.TabOrientation
member.summary: Gets sets horizontal or vertical orientation of text and images in tabs.

remarks.p:
Notes:
If vertical orientation is enabled, then for Top and Bottom tabs locations the TabsOverflow.Reduce is not supported. If vertical orientation is enabled and line breaks are used, then TextOverflow.Ellipsis is not supported.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.WebTab.TabLocation
member.summary: Gets sets location of tabs relative to content pane.

remarks.p:
Notes:
The values of TopRight, BottomRight, LeftBottom and RightBottom are supported only for DisplayMode.SingleRow.
The LeftBottom and RightBottom have effect only at run time and at design time tabs are rendered at the top.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.WebTab.DisplayMode
member.summary: Gets sets display mode of tabs such as single row, scrollable single row, multi row or multi row auto.

remarks.p:
Notes:
Multirow is not supported when tabs are located on left or right sides, or when tabs are located on top or bottom and orientation is vertical.
If multi row is enabled and tabs are located on top or bottom, then add-new-tab item is not supported and tab-moving is not recommended to use due to possible misbehavior.
If multi row is enabled and tabs are located on left or right and orientation is vertical, then tabs are stretched to the height of control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.WebTab.EnableOverlappingTabs
member.summary: Gets sets ability for tab labels to overlap their siblings.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.WebTab.VerticalTextMode
member.summary: Gets sets writing mode used to draw vertical text.

remarks.p: That property is supported by IE browsers only. When it is enabled, then style attribute "writing-mode:tb-rl" is used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.WebTab.EnableActivation
member.summary: Gets sets ability to get focus and respond on keys in order to change active tab and select it.

remarks.p:
If that property is enabled, then
WebTab will get focus on tabbing according to tab order of elements on page and selected tab will be activated
Tab item will be activated on mousedown
Active tab item will be changed on arrows, Home and End keys
Active tab item will be selected on Space or Enter keys

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.WebTab.TabItemSize
member.summary: Gets sets width of tab item when TabOrientation is horizontal or height of tab item when TabOrientation is vertical.

remarks.p:
Notes:
That property may have no effect for some combinations of TabLocation and TabOrientation and only pixel and percentage values are supported.
If DisplayMode is set to multi row and tabs are located at top or bottom and orientation is horizontal, then tabs are stretched to the width of control.
If DisplayMode is set to multi row and tabs are located at left or right and orientation is vertical, then tabs are stretched to the height of control.
If tabs are located at left or right and orientation is horizontal, then default value of 100px is used regardless of content of tabs. If application needs other size, then that property should be set.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.WebTab.TextOverflow
member.summary: Gets sets option to show ellipsis "...", if content of tab does not fit in its bounds.

remarks.p:
Notes:
If value is set to Clip, then text is clipped by bounds of tab item and may run over possible close button and other elements.
If value is set to Ellipsis and orientation is vertical and text is built by line breaks, then "..." is not supported, however the length of text is reduced to fit it in client area.
If Text of tab item contains html tags (inner elements), then that property is not supported for those tab items.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.WebTab.SelectedIndex
member.summary: Gets sets index of selected tab item.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.WebTab.TabsOverflow
member.summary: Gets sets option to reduce sizes of tabs if their overall size does not fit in size of control.

remarks.p: In case of tabs located on top or bottom that property has effect only when TabOrientation is horizontal, DisplayMode is SingleRow or MultiRow and width of WebTab is set. In case of tabs located on left or right that property has effect only when TabOrientation is vertical, DisplayMode is SingleRow and height of WebTab is set.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.WebTab.EnableValidation
member.summary: Gets sets option to validate asp Validators located in selected tab when selected tab is changed or reloading content of tab is requested.

remarks.p: If validation fails, then change selection or reload action is canceled. Validation is supported for child controls located in ContentPane of selected tab item and for ContentUrl which points to a local aspx.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.WebTab.VisibleHeader
member.summary: Gets sets visibility of header.

remarks.p: That property does not affect rendering of html elements to client, but only changes their visibility.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.WebTab.VisibleContent
member.summary: Gets sets visibility of content.

remarks.p: That property does not affect rendering of html elements to client, but only changes their visibility.

member.summary: Not supported property

member.summary: Not used by control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.WebTab.TabMoving
member.summary: Gets reference to container of properties related to ability to move tab item by mouse drag.

remarks.p:
Notes:
Move of any item on client may trigger change of VisibleIndex properties of all tab items.
If DisplayMode is MultiRow, then it is not recommended to enable that property, because it may trigger misbehavior, tabs can be moved within same row only and after a postback visible indexes can be reset to original values.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.WebTab.TabItemStates
member.summary: Gets reference to container of properties related to supported states of tab items.

remarks.p:
Notes:
The more states are enabled, the higher possibility that tabs will flicker on state change and the larger size of generated html.
That class does not affect custom css properties set by TabItemCssClasses objects.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.WebTab.AjaxIndicator
member.summary: Gets reference to container of properties related to ajax indicator.

remarks.p: If value of a sub-property is not set, then corresponding property of shared indicator is used. Shared indicator can be accessed on server using Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.AppSettings.SharedAjaxIndicator and on client: $util.get_ajaxIndicator().

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.DropDownBot
member.summary: The RunBot class is a companion to the main control class of a companion. It's primary function is to offload control functionality so that the main control is free to inherit from any other control class in the ASP.NET framework. Since the main control object is a rather heavy object, it is best to put as much functionality into base classes so that it can be shared and reused. But if the main control object must inherit from a base class other than one defined in the framework, then it would not be able to participate in the framework without duplicating a great deal of code. Therefore, by offloading the majority of functionality from the control object itself to a RunBot derivation class, the framework logic can be kept in the RunBot and the control can derive from any base class it needs to.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.DropDownBot.LoadClientCollectionsTransactionList(System.Object[])
member.summary: A.T. 11 / 09/ 2009 we need this so that items state is loaded before the properties so that SelectedItemIndex is set to the correct item. Why? because the new implementation for SelectedItemIndex's getter will basically loop through the items and return the first selected item. If item's state is not updated, we will end up returning the old selection ASP DropDownList and ListControl are functioning in the same way (i.e. looping through items) this enables us to return the correct selected index, when selection is just set by setting the Selected property of any item.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.DropDownRoles.DropDownListReadOnly
member.summary:
A TD on the left side of the ImageArea.
This CSS Class should be used for applying a Background-Image along the left border of the control.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.DropDownRoles.DropDownListContainer
member.summary:
A TD that wraps the Footer.
This CSS Class should be used for applying a Background-Image along the bottom border of the control.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.DropDownRoles.DropDownListContainerHover
member.summary:
The Top Left corner of the control.
This CSS Class should be used for rounded corners.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.DropDownRoles.DropDownButton
member.summary:
The Top Right corner of the control.
This CSS Class should be used for rounded corners.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.DropDownRoles.DropDownButtonHover
member.summary:
The Bottom Left corner of the control.
This CSS Class should be used for rounded corners.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.DropDownRoles.ListItem
member.summary:
The CSS class that will be applied to the Previous Button.
The Previous Button can be absolutely positoned anywhere in the control, because the WebImageViewer has an internal DIV that wraps the control with a position set to relative.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.DropDownRoles.ListItemHover
member.summary:
The CSS class that will be applied to the Container of the Next Button.
This css Class is the TD in which the Image element is rendered. This style can be used to set the vetical-align CSS attribute.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.DropDownRoles.ListItemSelected
member.summary:
The CSS class that will be applied to the Next Button.
The Next Button can be absolutely positoned anywhere in the control, because the WebImageViewer has an internal DIV that wraps the control with a position set to relative.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.DropDownRoles.ListItemDisabled
member.summary:
A TD that contains the ImageArea.
If you would like a border around the ImageArea, this is the class to use.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.DropDownRoles.Pager
member.summary:
A DIV that contains all of the Images.
In XHTML, to apply a border around the images a padding-bottom must be set to the size of the border-top-width plus the border-bottom-width.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.summary: Control which implements the functionality of a web drop down

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ListControl.OnInit(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Override of OnInit to handle the initialization of references for those items that have been parsed in from the aspx page. Since the items are first pushed onto a stack as they are parsed and then formed into collections later, there is no sooner opportunity to establish back references between objects and their owner/control.
member.param: EventArgs reference

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ListControl.OnItemBound(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Virtual method called whenever an Item is bound to a datasource record. The default implementation first the ItemBound Event.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ListControl.ClearDataItems
member.summary: Called by the DataBinding objects to tell the Control that the Items collection should be cleared prior to commencement of a fresh databinding operation.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ListControl.FindTemplateById(System.String)
member.summary: Searches the ItemTemplates within this collection and returns a reference to the first one that matches the templateId passed in.
member.param: The Id of the ItemTemplate to look for.
member.returns: ItemTemplate whose Id matches the templateId passed in. Returns null if none is found.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ListControl.EnsureTemplates
member.summary: Overrides the framework invocation to instantiate all templates for the control that are needed. This method is called automatically by the framework during the page lifecycle to ensure that all templates are created.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ListControl.InstantiateTemplates(Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.ObjectCollection)
member.summary: Called from the EnsureTemplates override to walk the control's items collection and instantiate the necessary templates on each object within it. If an item has children, then the method is called recursively to instantiate the templates of the children where applicable.
member.param: The Items collection of the ListControl.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ListControl.ClearTemplates
member.summary: Overrides the framework invocation to clear all templates that exist for the control so that fresh templates can be instantiated. This method is called primarily from designers when templates have been edited so that the control can be refreshed with the updated templates.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ListControl.ClearTemplates(Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.ObjectCollection)
member.summary: Called from the ClearTemplates override to walk the control's items collection and clear the existing template on each object within it. If an item has children, then the method is called recursively to clear the templates of the children where applicable.
member.param: The Items collection of the NavControl.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ListControl.InstantiateTemplate(Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ListItem)
member.summary: Instantiates any specified templates for a NavItem if they have not already been instantiated.
member.remarks: Templates for a NavItem can be instantiated in any one of three ways: 1. The NavItem has a non-null Template property set. 2. The NavItem has a non-empty TemplateId property set. 3. The NavControl has a non-null ItemTemplate property set. The order and priority of resolution is as described.
member.param: The particular NavItem for template instantiation.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ListControl.ResolveItem(System.String)
member.summary: Translates an address string specifier into the resolved NavItem object that lives at the specified address.
member.param: The full address specifier for an item. If the collecion is a 'flat' collection, this address is synonomous with the Index of the item. If the collection is hierarchical, the fullAddress will contain delimiters that can be used to break down the address into partial addresses which are then resolved in turn.
member.remarks: For Example: '0.3.2' specifies the item at index 2 whose parent is at index 3 of the collection who's parent is index 0 of the top-level collection.
member.returns: The NavItem object that corresponds to the passed in address specifier.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ListControl.Items
member.summary: Collection of items at the root level of the ListControl.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ListControl.DataBindingManager
member.summary: Gets a reference to the DataBindingManager for this control. The Control will normally instantiate a derived DataBindingManager class from within the CreateDataBindingManager virtual override which is called by this Property the first time the DataBindingManaber is referenced.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ListControl.Templates
member.summary: Gets a ControlCollection that contains instances of ItemTemplate objects which can be shared among items within the derived Control by seting the Item.TemplateId property to the Id of an ItemTemplate.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ListControl.ItemTemplate
member.summary: An ITemplate object that will be applied as a template for all items within the control unless an individual Item has a non-null Template property of its own, or it has its TemplateId set to refer to an ItemTemplate in the ItemTemplates collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.NullText

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.SelectedValue
member.summary: Returns/sets the text of the currently selected item

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.SelectedItemIndex
member.summary: Returns/sets the selected item index in the dropdown item list

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.ActiveItemIndex
member.summary: Returns/sets the active item index in the dropdown item list

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.ShowDropDownButton
member.summary: Returns/sets an indicator if the drop down button component is shown or not

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.DropDownContainerMaxHeight
member.summary:
Returns/sets the maximum height to which the value list can grow so that no scroll bars are shown
Setting the value list height to 0 means that contents will grow

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.DropDownOffsetX
member.summary:
Returns/sets the horizontal offset of the dropdown container relative to the dropdown value display
default (0) means that the dropdown container and the value display will be perfectly aligned horizontally

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.DropDownOffsetY
member.summary:
Returns/sets the vertical offset of the dropdown container relative to the dropdown value display
default (0) means that the dropdown container and the value display will be perfectly aligned vertically

member.summary: Returns/sets an indicator of whether paging is enabled for the item collection in the dropdown container or not

member.summary: pager settings

member.summary: Background color of control

member.summary: Border width of control

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.BorderStyle
member.summary: Border style of control

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.PageSize
member.summary:

page size 0 means that all items will be displayed on the first and only page

member.summary: Indicates whether the WebDropDown will render itself and perform data-binding purely on the client-side

member.summary: Gets or sets the client rendering template.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.ClientRenderingTemplateContainer
member.summary: Gets the client rendering template container.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.EnableMultipleSelection
member.summary: Indicates whether multiple selection is enabled for items in the drop down container

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.MultipleSelectionType
member.summary: Indicates the type of multiple selection: Checkbox , keyboard

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.EnableClosingDropDownOnSelect
member.summary: Indicates whether the drop down container will be closed once an item is selected

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.SelectedItem
member.summary: Returns/sets the current selected item. Should be null if multiple selection is enabled

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.SelectedItems
member.summary: Returns the current list of selected items (applies when multiple selection is enabled)

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.Items
member.summary: The collection of DropDownItems in the WebDropDown.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.MultiSelectValueDelimiter
member.summary:
Returns/sets the delimiter for items shown in the value display, when multiple selection is enabled
null will be interpreted as comma

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.EnablePersistingCustomValues
member.summary: Indicates whether custom values entered in the value display should be persisted in the underlying data model or not

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.ValueDisplayType
member.summary:
Returns/sets the type of input (value display) component. It can be a simple input box, or a complex IG component that conforms to some predefined interface
see DropDownValueDisplayType. null will render a simple input component

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.EnableCustomValueSelection
member.summary: Indicates whether custom values can be selected, once they are persisted and appear in the list

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.EnableAutoFiltering
member.summary: Indicates whether auto filtering will be enabled once the something is typed in the value display

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.AutoSelectOnMatch
member.summary: Indicates whether matched item will be automatically selected while filtering in the dropdown new property in 9.2

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.KeepFocusOnSelection
member.summary: Indicates whether input will be automatically re-focused once an item from the dropdown is selected

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.AutoFilterQueryType
member.summary: Returns/sets the search query type for auto filtering . By default this is "StartsWith", but it can be anything

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.AutoFilterResultSize
member.summary:
Returns/sets the number of items that auto filtering will return
a negative value will reset the auto filter to its default value

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.EmptyFilterBehavior
member.summary: controls the filtering functionaltiy when the input is empty (empty string)

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.EnableCustomValues
member.summary: by default this is true. If set to false, the user will not be allowed to type everything in the input box but only when there is a match among the items

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.EnableMarkingMatchedText
member.summary: this will enclose matched text fragments with "em" markup by default it's switched off

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.EnableCachingOnClient
member.summary: When caching on the client is performed, if we have already done a filter postback with a specified filter string, the results will be directly obtained from client cache, and no subsequent postbacks will be made

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.AutoFilterTimeoutMs
member.summary: when we are typing text in the dropdown value display input box, we do not do a postback (filtering) on every key stroke but instead use a timeout and do a postback after this timeout duration. This property allows the developer to configure this timeout

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.AutoFilterSortOrder
member.summary: Returns/sets the sorting (ascending or descending) that will be applied on the filtering results .

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.EnableAutoCompleteFirstMatch
member.summary: Indicates whether while the user is typing, the rest of the first matching item's characters will be displayed selected in the value display box

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.EnableLoadOnDemand
member.summary: Indicates whether load on demand is enabled or not. When load on demand is enabled, the value of pageSize will be automatically used for the row fetch size on each load on demand request

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.LoadingItemsMessageText
member.summary: If this property is set, while items are loaded during AJAX postback, a message will appear notifying that loading is in progress

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.EnableClosingDropDownOnBlur
member.summary: if this is set to false, the dropdown container will stay open, even if the control loses focus (set this to false if you want the dropdown to stay open when you scroll for example)

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.TextField
member.summary: Returns/sets the field name for multi-column/complex data set, that will be used as the text to shown in the value display box

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.ValueField
member.summary: Returns/sets the field name for multi-column/complex data set, that will be used as the value to store in each item in the item list

member.summary: current page index when paging is enabled. Server only property

member.summary: Type of the animation : see DropDownAnimationTypes enum

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.EnableDropDownAsChild

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.EnableRenderingAnchors
member.summary: will not render anchors for list items, if set to false

member.summary:
Returns/sets the fixed width of the dropdown container itself
if this is zero, or not set at all, the dropdown will be aligned with the value display and the dropdown button (if any)

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.WebDropDown.DropDownContainerHeight
member.summary:

if this is zero or not set at all, the height will grow depending on the number of items in the list

member.summary: indicates whether matching and autofiltering is case sensitive or not

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ImageViewerRoles.Control
member.summary:
The CSS Class that will be applied to the outer control.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ImageViewerRoles.HeaderPadding
member.summary:
The CSS Class that will be applied to the outer control when the Header is Visible.
This class should be used for setting any padding that might be needed if the Header is placed above the control.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ImageViewerRoles.HeaderContentArea
member.summary:
The CSS class that will be applied to the header.
The header can be absolutely positoned anywhere in the control, because the WebImageViewer has an internal DIV that wraps the control with a position set to relative.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ImageViewerRoles.HeaderContentLeft
member.summary:
The CSS class that will be applied to the Left Corner of the Header.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ImageViewerRoles.HeaderContent
member.summary:
The CSS class that will be applied to the actual content of the Header.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ImageViewerRoles.HeaderContentRight
member.summary:
The CSS class that will be applied to the Right Corner of the Header.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ImageViewerRoles.HeaderArea
member.summary:
A TR that wraps the TopLeft, TopArea, and TopRight elements.
This CSS class is useful in setting the height of the entire row.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

The CSS Class that will be applied to the outer control when the Footer is Visible.

Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.summary:
The CSS class that will be applied to the Left Corner of the Footer.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.summary:
The CSS class that will be applied to the actual content of the Footer.

The CSS class that will be applied to the Right Corner of the Footer.

member.summary:
The Bottom Right corner of the control.

Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.summary:
The CSS class that will be applied to the Container of the Previous Button.
This css Class is the TD in which the Image element is rendered. This style can be used to set the vertical-align CSS attribute.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ImageViewerRoles.PrevButton
member.summary:
The CSS class that will be applied to the Previous Button.
The Previous Button can be absolutely positoned anywhere in the control, because the WebImageViewer has an internal DIV that wraps the control with a position set to relative.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.summary:

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ImageViewerRoles.ImageAreaContainer
member.summary:
A TD that contains the ImageArea.
If you would like a border around the ImageArea, this is the class to use.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ImageViewerRoles.ImageArea
member.summary:
A DIV that contains all of the Images.
In XHTML, to apply a border around the images a padding-bottom must be set to the size of the border-top-width plus the border-bottom-width.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ImageViewerRoles.Image
member.summary:
An IMG element that is contained by the ImageAra.
In XHTML, to apply a border around an image a padding-bottom must be set to the size of the border-top-width plus the border-bottom-width on the ImageArea.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ImageViewerRoles.ImageSelected
member.summary:
Applied to an IMG when it is selected.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ImageViewerRoles.ImageHover
member.summary:
Applied to an IMG when the mouse is over it.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ImageViewerRoles.OtherImageHover
member.summary:
When an image is hovered, this style gets applied to all other images.
A good use of this style is to apply an opacity to all other images that aren't being hovered, so that the hovered image has more focus.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ImageViewerRoles.ImageDisabled
member.summary:
Applied to an IMG when the image is disabled.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

Applied when Orientation is set to Vertical.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ImageViewerRoles.ImageArea_Vert
member.summary:
A DIV that contains all of the Images.
In XHTML, to apply a border around the images a padding-right must be set to the size of the border-left-width plus the border-right-width.
Applied when Orientation is set to Vertical.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ImageViewerRoles.Image_Vert
member.summary:
An IMG element that is contained by the ImageAra.
In XHTML, to apply a border around an image a padding-right must be set to the size of the border-left-width plus the border-right-width on the ImageArea_Vert.
Applied when Orientation is set to Vertical.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ImageViewerRoles.ImageSelected_Vert
member.summary:
Applied to an IMG when it is selected.
Applied when Orientation is set to Vertical.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ImageViewerRoles.ImageHover_Vert
member.summary:
Applied to an IMG when the mouse is over it.
Applied when Orientation is set to Vertical.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ImageViewerRoles.OtherImageHover_Vert
member.summary:
When an image is hovered, this style gets applied to all other images.
A good use of this style is to apply an opacity to all other images that aren't being hovered, so that the hovered image has more focus.
Applied when Orientation is set to Vertical.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ImageViewerRoles.ImageDisabled_Vert
member.summary:
Applied to an IMG when the image is disabled.
Applied when Orientation is set to Vertical.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ImageViewerBot
member.summary: The RunBot class is a companion to the main control class of a companion. It's primary function is to offload control functionality so that the main control is free to inherit from any other control class in the ASP.NET framework. Since the main control object is a rather heavy object, it is best to put as much functionality into base classes so that it can be shared and reused. But if the main control object must inherit from a base class other than one defined in the framework, then it would not be able to participate in the framework without duplicating a great deal of code. Therefore, by offloading the majority of functionality from the control object itself to a RunBot derivation class, the framework logic can be kept in the RunBot and the control can derive from any base class it needs to.

It stores and maintains the collection of WebBinding objects that determine which columns or properties in the data source objects are bound to the various properties of the control object model.

member.remarks: This method normally passes on the request to the owner control which will create the actual object on behalf of the DataBindingManager

member.summary:
Returns/sets the Animation type that the WebImageViewer will use to scroll images into view.
Continuous - While the Next/Previous buttons are pressed, the ImageViewer will continue to scroll.
Page - The ImageViewer will scroll the Next non-visible Image into view.
NextItem - The ImageViewer will scroll Next/Previous image to the specified ScrollToAlignment.

Near - The left/top edge of the image will align with the left/top most area of the visible image area.
Center - The center of the image will align with the center of the visible image area.
Far - The right/bottom edge of the image will align with the right/bottom most area of the visible image area.

member.summary: Called from the EnsureTemplates override to walk the control's items collection and instantiate the necessary templates on each object within it. If an item has children, then the method is called recursively to instantiate the templates of the children where applicable.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.NavigationControls.NavControl.ClearTemplates
member.summary: Overrides the framework invocation to clear all templates that exist for the control so that fresh templates can be instantiated. This method is called primarily from designers when templates have been edited so that the control can be refreshed with the updated templates.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.NavigationControls.NavControl.ClearTemplates(Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalObjectCollection)
member.summary: Called from the ClearTemplates override to walk the control's items collection and clear the existing template on each object within it. If an item has children, then the method is called recursively to clear the templates of the children where applicable.
member.param: The Items collection of the NavControl.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.NavigationControls.NavControl.InstantiateTemplate(Infragistics.Web.UI.NavigationControls.NavItem)
member.summary: Instantiates any specified templates for a NavItem if they have not already been instantiated.
member.remarks: Templates for a NavItem can be instantiated in any one of three ways: 1. The NavItem has a non-null Template property set. 2. The NavItem has a non-empty TemplateId property set. 3. The NavControl has a non-null ItemTemplate property set. The order and priority of resolution is as described.
member.param: The particular NavItem for template instantiation.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.NavigationControls.NavControl.ResolveItem(System.String)
member.summary: Translates an address string specifier into the resolved NavItem object that lives at the specified address.
member.param: The full address specifier for an item. If the collecion is a 'flat' collection, this address is synonomous with the Index of the item. If the collection is hierarchical, the fullAddress will contain delimiters that can be used to break down the address into partial addresses which are then resolved in turn.
member.remarks: For Example: '0.3.2' specifies the item at index 2 whose parent is at index 3 of the collection who's parent is index 0 of the top-level collection.
member.returns: The NavItem object that corresponds to the passed in address specifier.
